58e10e8d72782604c488bd35,mastodon.xyz,False,28496,"

Follow @status for status updates, planned downtimes, etc.
You may support the hosting of this instance on Liberapay or Patreon.
There are no restrictions of content on this instance, however, to keep it pleasant to everyone here are a few rules.
Any user not respecting these rules may get silenced or suspended.
Also remember you have the ability to report users if they don't respect these rules.
• Racist, sexist, homophobic, etc. messages are prohibited
• Parodic accounts are accepted but must mention they are parodic in their description
• NSFW content cannot be published publicly and must be unlisted or private.
• Bots are allowed. However, bots tooting in the public timelines may get silenced if they toot too much. Bots mentionning users too many times without their consent may get suspended.

On social.tchncs.de our primary directive is:
Please remember there are real people on the other side of the screen, and those people may have different feelings
and opinions and experiences than you do. Some of them may be tired or having a bad day. Or you might.

When someone asks you to leave them alone, leave them alone. If you feel like you can'
respond to that person, use the block or mute feature so you won&#x27
column2: t see their posts and be tempted.

column1: Keep in mind that while you cannot control other people'
column2: s behavior, you are still responsible for your own

column1: conduct, even if you feel someone was rude to you or someone else.
We will not allow abusive or disruptive conduct by or toward users on social.tchncs.de. This includes continuing to
engage in conversation with someone who has specifically requested you leave them alone, inciting other users to
engage with that person on your behalf, aggregating and posting another person&#x27
their consent, and inciting others to engage with that person on other platforms. Blocking someone and then sitting
on the other side of a block and continuing to talk about that person is also a provoking behavior.
Before you post, think about whether this is the kind of thing you would like to see (or would like your mom or kids
to see) in the public timeline. There are post visibility settings that give you some control over which timelines
your post appears in, and also CW and NSFW buttons to hide specific text and images in your post. Be a good social
media neighbor and use these functions when appropriate.

This instance is hosted on virtuals machines on Gandi infrastructure at Bissen.
12 + 6 + 2 + 16 GB of RAM
Hosted at Gandi, in Bissen, Luxembourg.
IPv6 compatible, always running the latest stable of Mastodon
Weekly backups of the database and files, on another server hosted at Ikoula, in Reims, France.
I also backup the backups once in a while to a server in my home.
,European mastodon instance hosted in Luxembourg. Also beer, privacy and free software lovers. Join us!
This service is managed by alarig and valere.
this is our ship and it was built for Liberation, back in 2017 when i joined this federated ocean, to have a reliable space for myself and any friend who felt safer here.

to be free from sexists, racists, transphobes, homophobes, ableists, eugenicists, capitalists, classists, nazis, liberals, and self-sufficient libertarians all the same. they will be shot on sight and without trial or warning or mercy. all cops are bastards, all terves will die alone, all nazis shall be skinned first.
this is a place where we can live and express ourselves freely as oppressed masses of violent systems
column2: it is about seizing our social media and having a place to accompany us thru our struggles, where freedom is about punching up, not down or sideways.

column1: a feminist, anarchist, communist, cyberpunk culture, with many trans and queer people, often with tech or scientific interests.
if you're a part of it, i will fight for you and by your side. if you betray us, you will be thrown overboard.
we use the defederation cannon often & easily
column2: any instance that will inflict such pains on me or my users will be suspended as we see fit. free speech types are not on thin ice, our hull will go right thru them.

column1: * bot accounts: are allowed, but i would like to be asked first, and it has to be of public interest or a personal project of yours. if it posts frequently, consider auto-deleting the posts after a while to free space.
* content warnings: are encouraged, with no strict requirements except for public timelines (porn & violence). this is foremost between you and who will see your posts
our first & most important rule is inspired by a quote of Fannie Lou Hamer.

Are you an educator who wants to use botsin.space for teaching/learning purposes? I'm begging you to contact me at @muffinista@botsin.space -- I can give you an invite code for your students.
This instance exists for people who want to run Mastodon bots. Bots and their humans are expected to follow this Code of Conduct.
If you want to setup an account to get an RSS feed onto Mastodon, please check out feedsin.space.
When you're signing up, you must put the magic word into your signup request to show that you've read this. The magic word is.... spreadsheet
You can learn more about ways to support the costs of this instance.

Please Note: botsin.space is running some custom code to limit posting to the public timeline. Once an account makes a public post, any posts for the next six hours will be set to unlisted. This change exists to allow a certain amount of bot traffic on public feeds, while not polluting the timeline all that much. For context, you can read this toot.
NOTE: If you have questions or concerns, feel free to
Here are some basic rules for the instance:
<li>Anyone is welcome to open an account to use either as a personal
account, or to run a bot.
• Do not use bots to abuse other people. Bots should punch up, not down.
<li>Open as many bot accounts as you like, but please do not abuse
this privilege! Don't setup a bot farm or something like that.
<li>If you run a bot here, please be kind to the servers. If the
instance starts to bog down, bots that are making excessive API calls
<li>Please be mindful of the tools that Mastodon provides to mask
potentially troubling content from users. If appropriate, please use
content warnings, and consider not placing your toots in the public
<li>The following types of content are forbidden, and posting them
will result in immediate termination of your account:
• Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
• Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
• Stalking or harassment of other users, both on the instance and anywhere in the fediverse
<li>The following types of content are also prohibited and can
result in your account being silenced, and possibly terminated:
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Don't create bots that exist only to follow/monitor other accounts, map the fediverse, track users, or other similar behavior.
• Furthermore, your bot might be suspended for things not listed here if the moderators decide it is inappropriate. If you have any questions about potential bots, please feel free to ask.
Here are some more detailed rules for the instance:
This community is dedicated to providing a harassment-free
experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants
This code of conduct applies to all of this community's spaces,
including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both
online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be
sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the
We hope to create an environment in which diverse individuals can
collaborate and interact in a positive and affirming way. Examples of
behavior that contributes to creating this sort of environment
• Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
• Focusing on what is best for the overall community
This community will not tolerate harassment of any kind. Examples

• Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, pregnancy status, veteran status, political affiliation, marital status, body size, age, race, national origin, ethnic origin, nationality, immigration status, language, religion or lack thereof, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
• Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, relationships, drugs, and employment.
• Deliberate misgendering, using inappropriate pronouns, or use of ""dead"" or rejected names.
• Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where they're not appropriate.
• Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ""hug"" or ""backrub"") without consent or after a request to stop.
• Incitement of violence towards any individual or group, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
• Stalking or following - online or in the physical world.
• Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
• Patterns of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others.
• Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
• Deliberate ""outing"" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
• Jokes that resemble the above, such as ""hipster racism"", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
If you have questions or concerns about these issues please feel free to message an admin or ask for an opportunity to explore the issue with a moderator and volunteers.

If you think that an account on this instance is violating this Code of Conduct, or is doing something offensive or should be otherwise handled by the administrators, the easiest way to report them is to use the reporting tool that is part of Mastodon. You can do that using the 'Report' tool which is embedded in every toot:
If you would rather not use the reporting tool, if the harassment
is happening outside of botsin.space, or if you have any other
concerns, please contact the administrators via the methods listed at
the top of this page. If the person who is harassing you is on the
admin team, they will not be involved in handling or resolving the
The admin team will respond to any complaint as promptly as

possible we can. If you do not get a timely response (for example, if no admins are currently online) then please put your personal safety and well-being first, and consider logging out and/or contacting the admins by email at colin at muffinlabs dot com.
This code of conduct applies to our community's spaces, but if you
are being harassed by a member of our community outside our spaces, we
still want to know about it. We will take all good-faith reports of
harassment by our members, especially the administrators,
seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment
that took place at any point in time. The abuse team reserves the
right to exclude people from the community based on their past
behavior, including behavior outside of our spaces and behavior
towards people who are not in this community.
In order to protect volunteers from abuse and burnout, we reserve
the right to reject any report we believe to have been made in bad
faith. Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted
Every code of conduct violation report will be treated with
seriousness and care. If a member's immediate safety and security is
threatened, an individual admin may take any action that they deem
appropriate, up to and including temporarily banning the offender from
the community. In less urgent situations, at least two admins will
discuss the offense and mutually arrive at a suitable response, which
will be shared with the offender privately. Whatever the resolution
that they decide upon, the decision of the admins involved in a
violation case will be considered final.
We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of
protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a
person about whom we've received harassment complaints, or privately
warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will
increase the safety of our members or the general public. We will not
name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to
comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior,
the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to
and including expulsion from the community and identification of the
participant as a harasser to other members. At the discretion of the
admins, or by request, one or more of the parties involved may request
to discuss the violation and how to avoid similar situations in the

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Community Covenant (http://community-covenant.net), version 1.0, available at http://community-covenant.net/version/1/0/. The Community Covenant is an open source effort and is built on codes of conduct that came before it, including the Contributor Covenant and the LGBTQ in Tech community code of conduct.

Community Covenant by Coraline Ada Ehmke is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
Based on a work at http://community-covenant.net/.
If you would like to help with the costs of running this instance, you can do that via Patreon, or via Paypal. Thanks!

This instance is focused around the furry community, and is open to anyone interested in it. It was created by @Tiwy57 originally for a small group of furry friends, but thought it might as well be open to all fluffies and scalies !
Meow is federated to nearly all instances of the fediverse, which means you can follow pretty much anyone you want, no matter what instance they are on!

While it is open publicly, mind this is just one instance in the fediverse, and we encourage you to look at other instances available to be sure it‚Äôs the one you like, and if none please you and you got the knowledge to set things up, why not help the fediverse grow by making your own instance too!
If you like meow, consider donating something via Liberapay, Patreon, Ko-fi or paypal!

As a general rule, any form of indexing/scraping/collection of data of this instance for subsequent export or analysis processing without explicit expressed written consent of each user is prohibited and is unauthorized.

In the same way, using meow.social to train automated learning models (AI) in order to extract different information and also for the purpose of analysis without the consent of the administrators is prohibited.
If you are a student, analyst, or journalist, please contact us via our contact form and specify your needs: https://support.meow.social/
<ul><li>If actions from users on other instances break our rules, check ifthe rules of the instance to which the user belongs are also broken before activating the &quot

column10: sections to check. Instances that do no have any rules listed anywhere are de facto considered as unmoderated and will be suspended, you can specify the unmoderated nature of the source instance in your report.

column1: Failure to respect any of rules will lead to a warning, content removal, silencing, and/or suspension of your account.
The Teams have the absolute right to decide to delete your account at their discretion.

We reserve the absolute right to take any actions regarding any instances that are connected with this instance. If your instance is detrimental to the overall good functioning of the fediverse or meow.social, we will silence or completely suspend it.

You may discuss with the admins if you feel you were unfairly sanctioned (through DMs or by sending us an email if your account is suspended), so long as you don‚Äôt try and force your way after the final statement has been decided.
If you require any help or need to contact us, reach us through contact form at https://support.meow.social/

58e7f68e8313ad45cf80418b,queer.party,False,6147,"

queer.party (q.p) is a queer-oriented Mastodon instance which generally aligns itself with the policies and goals of other instances such as mastodon.social, awoo.space and icosahedron.website,
aiming as much as possible to be a safe space for its users. The rules pretty much boil down to ""be good to each other"", but a few rules I'd like to explicitly list out are as follows:
• Any content or postings which may be illegal under German or Scottish law are not permitted.
• Any content or postings containing Nazi symbolism, ideology and the promotion thereof, are strictly forbidden and seriously uncool.

• Racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia and any other discriminatory conduct which attacks any individual or group of individuals based on what they are or what they believe in, is strictly forbidden and also seriously uncool.
• Any conduct which abuses this Mastodon instance, or which causes harm to other Mastodon instances, and/or the users thereof, is strictly forbidden and seriously uncool.

• While essentially all posts not violating the above are welcome on this instance, you are asked to be considerate and respectful of others - for example, tagging a post about a controversial subject or a commonly-held phobia using content warnings.
• Basic parts of your user profile, such as username/display name, profile picture and banner, must not be explicit in nature.
• Explicit/NSFW content is allowed, but must be appropriately tagged using the sensitive media and content warning tags.
This server abides by and has committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

This is not Twitter. Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is encouraged. Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. Due to timezone differences or just the fact that I have a full-time job, it may take more than a week. When filing a report, please include information about why you are making the report.

As this instance, and the fediverse in general, has grown, so too have the moderation demands -- in complex cases, I will reach out to you regarding your report, either to explain the moderation decision taken (if any) or to ask for more information, but for more obvious cases, I unfortunately no longer have the time to notify you as to the status of your report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us.
No moderation actions are automatic whatsoever. Nothing happens without human review, and I try my utmost to do right by the users on this instance.

For anything that isn't covered by reporting things in Mastodon, or if you have any questions, concerns or other thoughts, please either direct-message @Maffsie@queer.party, or email the queries address posted above - this goes directly to my inbox.

queer.party is not a company. This Mastodon instance is operated and moderated solely by one person - me (@Maffsie@queer.party). Funding for hosting the service is provided out of my own pocket, and in the past a number of people have given donations via the tip-jar (now closed). I do not ask for or accept funding by any other means, nor do I accept donations when I do not strictly need them.

queer.party runs on free, open-source software atop human-managed hardware. This means, all software involved in operating queer.party and serving it to the world is open-source and freely licensed. This is, currently, the following:
This also means that all hardware involved in operating queer.party directly is leased, paid for and operated by myself. This currently is the following:

• ""the server"" - a Hetzner dedicated server in Falkenstein, Germany, running Alpine Linux, with everything down to the RAID controller being personally configured and managed. Costs approximately forty-eight euro (EUR ‚Ç¨48) per month.

• ""my server"" - a Hetzner dedicated server in Falkenstein, Germany, similarly configured to ""the server"", but primarily used for operating my own personal services, unrelated to queer.party. Hosts a Forgejo instance, which queer.party does use. Costs approximately forty euro (EUR ‚Ç¨40) per month.

• ""homebox"" - a diminuitive little NAS at my home which runs the authentication, authorisation and accounting platform that gates administrative access to queer.party's underlying infrastructure. Purchased in 2016, unknown monthly cost in electricity.
• ""the boy"" - a Raspberry Pi at my home which runs the Docker cluster management software controlling queer.party's deployment. Purchased in 2020, unknown monthly cost in electricity.

• ""ebay"" - a Pine64 A64-LTS board at my home which handles securely proxying traffic between my home infrastructure and the Hetzner infrastructure. Purchased in 2018, unknown monthly cost in electricity.
queer.party makes every reasonable effort to avoid third-parties, however this is sometimes unavoidable. The third parties currently involved, and their purposes and limitations, are as follows:

• Amazon Web Services' Simple Email Service - Used for sending email from queer.party to users, for the purposes of registration confirmation, opted-in notifications, and administrative communications. Not used for receiving email. Use requires providing email address, email subject, and email body to AWS. Unavoidable due to self-hosted email being operationally difficult, and other transactional email providers are more expensive. Costs vary based on user activity but currently average twenty cents (USD $0.20) per month.

• Digital Ocean's Domains service - Used for storing and serving the DNS zone for queer.party. Use requires Digital Ocean knowing the IP address of whichever DNS resolution service your computer uses for resolving domains. Unavoidable due to my self-hosted DNS cluster becoming unreliable and caused an outage of queer.party a few years ago and has not been used since. Currently does not have a cost.

• Digital Ocean's Spaces service - Used for storing compressed, AES-256-encrypted backups of the Postgres and Redis databases. Backups are fully encrypted before a connection to Digital Ocean is established. Does not transfer any information to Digital Ocean related to queer.party's operations or users. Unavoidable due to having no other infrastructure with the bandwidth and storage needed. Costs approximately five dollars (USD $5) per month.

• Backblaze's b2 Object Storage service - Used for storing compressed, AES-256-encrypted backups of user-uploaded media. Backups are fully encrypted before a connection to Backblaze is established. Remote media cached locally, and any user account archives, are explicitly excluded from the backups. Does not transfer any information to Backblaze related to queer.party's operations or users. Unavoidable due to, again, having no other infrastructure able and ready to store these backups at such low a cost. Average cost per month not yet known, but estimated to be around fifty cents (USD $0.50).

• Github Repository hosting - Used for fetching source code during the build process for queer.party's software. Unavoidable due to it just being Where The Code People Write Is Usually Stored. Free service.
• Docker Hub container image hosting - Used for fetching container images for the services operated for queer.party. Unavoidable due to it just being Where Container Images Are Stored. Free service.

queer.party's monthly operational cost is approximately ninety euro (EUR ‚Ç¨90), with an additional yearly cost of approximately twenty two dollars (USD $22) (may be lower due to deals and sales offered by the domain registrar).
This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji made by Dzuk, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This instance includes themes sourced from Hometown, cybre.space and Meemu. These themes are included automatically at build time and no claims are made as to ownership thereof, and all sourced themes are attributed to their source in the theme picker UI. If a theme has been made available on this instance and you would like it removed, please contact me and I will do so promptly and respectfully.
Transparency is important. Where administrative decisions have been made that impacts the userbase of queer.party, those decisions will be detailed on this page.

queer.party's federation policy is open-first, however in cases where an instance has been identified as either being indifferent to, permissive of, or as actively encouraging abusive conduct to this or other instances, that instance's domain will be blocked from federation. The block is typically a suspension, such that no interaction between queer.party and the offending instance can take place, however in cases where there is a lesser risk (eg., an instance that is indifferent to abusive conduct but is not known for being a source of abusive conduct), the block is typically a silence block, such that individual users can still interact with each other, but they must be following each other, and posts do not appear in the federated timeline. Such actions are generally only prompted by user reports, except in cases where the administrators of other instances are raising awareness of a new bad actor on the fediverse with reasonable evidence and outside confirmation.

An addendum to the above is the blanket suspension of federation with instances that claim to forbid abusive or hateful conduct, but which permit ""respectful"" ""discussions"" of ""unpopular opinions""/""controversial views"". Dessert pizza is an unpopular opinion, trans folks' right to live a happy life is not, and hate is hate regardless of how dressed-up it is.

Exceptions to the above are rare, but do happen. Currently, a blanket federation ban is in place for all Gab Social and Soapbox instances, for what should be obvious reasons. Where a specific instance has been blocked, it will be listed below. Due to the use of scraping tools and automated emails requesting to be unblocked, the domains may be partially obscured.
• not received any requests for data on its users
• not received any requests for data on any named user
• not received any requests for data on any federated instance
• not received any requests for data on any federated user
• not complied with any requests for data on its users
• not complied with any requests for data on any named user
• not complied with any requests for data on any federated instance
• not complied with any requests for data on any federated user

A modera√ß√£o do Masto.pt reserva-se ao direito de excluir pessoas do Masto.pt com base no seu comportamento anterior, incluindo comportamento fora dos espa√ßos Masto.pt e comportamento em rela√ß√£o a pessoas que n√£o est√£o no Masto.pt. Em caso de ass√©dio por parte de um utilizador, os administradores podem tomar as medidas que considerem adequadas, incluindo a expuls√£o de todos os espa√ßos do Masto.pt, a elimina√ß√£o dos seus dados e a identifica√ß√£o do participante como assediador a outros membros do Masto.pt ou ao p√∫blico em geral.

Publica√ß√µes com conte√∫do sexual (expl√≠cito ou n√£o), nudez e/ou que possa causar choque a terceiros t√™m de ser marcado com Content Warning e/ou os ficheiros marcados como media sens√≠vel. A inten√ß√£o √© que o Masto.pt seja uma plataforma SFW (Safe For Work) e n√£o por quaisquer quest√µes de moralismo ou pudor.

""Publica√ß√£o multiplataforma"" √© a c√≥pia autom√°tica de publica√ß√µes de uma plataforma para outra. Essa defini√ß√£o n√£o inclui publica√ß√µes simult√¢neas em v√°rias plataformas da mesma aplica√ß√£o, como Twidere ou PostyBirb. Se utlizares essas aplica√ß√µes, consideramos essas publica√ß√µes originais e o seguinte n√£o se aplica.

As publica√ß√µes multiplataforma de Mastodon para outras plataformas √© totalmente permitida. As publica√ß√µes multiplataforma no Mastodon a partir de outra plataforma √© permitida nos seguintes termos:

• As publica√ß√µes n√£o incluem refer√™ncias espec√≠ficas da plataforma, por exemplo, utilizando express√µes como ""aqui"", quando isso significa o Twitter, ou incluindo texto literal de outros utilizadores n√£o-Mastodon (por exemplo, tweets com cita√ß√µes de outros tweets).
• A conta √© monitorada pelo menos semirregularmente pelo autor, para que as intera√ß√µes dos utilizadores do Mastodon n√£o sejam ignoradas.
• A conta da publica√ß√£o multiplataforma pertence √† mesma pessoa que est√° a efectuar a publica√ß√£o no Mastodon. A c√≥pia de conte√∫do de terceiros n√£o √© permitida.

Os dados que publicares no Masto.pt residem num servidor gerido por Hugo Gameiro. Existe um compromisso de n√£o divulga√ß√£o ou leitura desses dados a n√£o ser em casos de manuten√ß√£o e modera√ß√£o da plataforma.

No entanto, este √© um servidor federado atrav√©s do protocolo ActivityPub. Isso significa que outras pessoas em outros servidores federados podem ver a tua informa√ß√£o, mensagens enviadas, etc. Isso tamb√©m significa que qualquer informa√ß√£o que colocares no Masto.pt, seja ela p√∫blica ou privada, pode acabar ""federada"" - basicamente, uma c√≥pia da tua publica√ß√£o √© enviada para qualquer servidor que recebe as tuas publica√ß√µes. Solicitamos que n√£o coloques no Masto.pt qualquer informa√ß√£o sens√≠vel ou que n√£o possa ser tornada p√∫blica.

• Informa√ß√µes b√°sicas da conta: quando te registas neste servidor, ser√° solicitado um nome de utilizador, um endere√ßo de e-mail e uma senha. Tamb√©m podes inserir outros detalhes de perfil adicionais, como nome p√∫blico, biografia, e fazer upload de uma imagem de perfil e imagem de cabe√ßalho. O nome de utilizador, nome p√∫blico, biografia, foto do perfil e imagem do cabe√ßalho s√£o sempre listados publicamente.

• Publica√ß√µes, seguidores e outras informa√ß√µes p√∫blicas: a lista de pessoas que segues e te seguem a ti √© listada publicamente, a n√£o ser que optes por tornar essas listas privadas. Quando envias uma mensagem, a data e a hora s√£o armazenadas, assim como a aplica√ß√£o do qual enviaste a mensagem. As publica√ß√µes p√∫blicas e n√£o listadas est√£o dispon√≠veis publicamente. As publica√ß√µes s√£o entregues aos teus seguidores isso significa que podem ser entregues a servidores diferentes e c√≥pias dessa publica√ß√£o podem ser armazenadas nesses servidores remotos. Quando eliminas uma publica√ß√£o, √© enviado um pedido de elimina√ß√£o aos servidores com utilizadores que te seguem mas n√£o existe uma certeza que as c√≥pias em servidores remotos sejam eliminadas, por isso pensa bem antes de publicares algo que um dia poder√°s querer eliminar.

• Publica√ß√µes diretas e somente para seguidores: as publica√ß√µes apenas para seguidores s√£o entregues aos teus seguidores e utilizadores que s√£o mencionados nelas, e as publica√ß√µes diretas s√£o entregues apenas aos utilizadores mencionados nelas. Nos casos em que esses teus seguidores (ou utilizadores mencionados) sejam remotos, uma c√≥pia √© enviada para esses servidores. Fazemos um esfor√ßo de boa f√© para limitar o acesso a essas publica√ß√µes apenas a pessoas autorizadas, mas outros servidores podem n√£o faz√™-lo. Portanto, √© importante ter em aten√ß√£o os servidores aos quais teus seguidores pertencem. Poder√°s activar uma op√ß√£o para aprovar e rejeitar novos seguidores manualmente nas configura√ß√µes. Lembra-te de que os operadores do servidor e de qualquer servidor remoto podem ver as tuas mensagens e que os destinat√°rios podem capturar imagens, copiar ou partilhar as mesmas de outra forma. N√£o partilhes nenhuma informa√ß√£o sens√≠vel ou que n√£o possa ser tornada p√∫blica.
Em que casos podem utilizar os meus dados?
Os dados que guardamos podem ser usada das seguintes formas:

• Para providenciar a funcionalidade central do Masto.pt. S√≥ podes interagir com o conte√∫do de outras pessoas e publicar o teu pr√≥prio conte√∫do se tiveres uma conta. Para al√©m disso ser√° necess√°rio uma conta para seguires utilizadores e para podermos agrupar o conte√∫do das pessoas que segues.
• Para ajudar na modera√ß√£o da comunidade, por exemplo, comparando o teu endere√ßo IP com outros conhecidos de abusos na comunidade.

Implementamos uma variedade de medidas de seguran√ßa para manter a seguran√ßa dos teus dados pessoais. Entre outras coisas, a sess√£o do teu navegador, bem como o tr√°fego entre as tuas aplica√ß√µes e a API s√£o protegidos por SSL e a tua senha √© criptografada usando um algoritmo unilateral forte.

Sim. Cookies s√£o pequenos arquivos que um site ou o seu provedor de servi√ßos transfere para o disco r√≠gido do teu computador por meio do navegador da Web (se o permitires). Os cookies s√£o necess√°rios para entrares na tua conta. Tamb√©m manteremos cookies para guardar as tuas prefer√™ncias para visitas futuras.

N√£o vendemos, trocamos ou de outra forma transferimos a terceiros os teus dados de identifica√ß√£o pessoal. Isso n√£o inclui terceiros de confian√ßa que nos ajudam a operar a nossa plataforma, desde que essas partes concordem em manter essas informa√ß√µes confidenciais. Tamb√©m podemos divulgar os teus dados quando acreditamos que √© apropriado para cumprir a lei, fazer cumprir as pol√≠ticas do nosso site ou proteger os nossos direitos, propriedade ou seguran√ßa de outros.

O teu conte√∫do p√∫blico pode ser copiado por outros servidores na rede. As tuas publica√ß√µes s√£o enviadas aos servidores onde estejam alojados os teus seguidores, com excep√ß√£o das mensagens diretas que s√£o enviadas apenas aos servidores dos destinat√°rios.

O nosso site √© direcionado a pessoas com pelo menos 16 anos de idade. N√£o utilizes este site se tens menos de 16 anos de idade.
Posso exportar ou eliminar os meus dados?
Sim a qualquer momento podes eliminar a tua conta e todos os dados associados a esta. Podes tamb√©m fazer download de toda a informa√ß√£o da tua conta em Importar e Exportar->Exportar Dados.
Lembramos que n√≥s iremos eliminar do nosso servidor e solicitamos aos servidores dos teus seguidores que fa√ßam o mesmo mas n√£o podemos garantir que eles o fa√ßam.

Os administradores reservam-se ao direito de atualizar as regras, c√≥digo de conduta e pol√≠tica de privacidade a qualquer momento e a seu crit√©rio. <li> This instance is hosted by Aquilenet, an associative, local and militant ISP in Aquitaine.
It is administered and moderated by volunteers under their own responsibility and not that of the association.
• The access is open for everyone, but account creation is subject to approval to limit spam.

• The moderation will be strict about cases of bad behaviour on the instance, which includes publishing offensive words or content(sexist, racist, LGBTQI+phobic, ableist, or judged as oppressive in any way) and the cases of cyber-harrassment towards an user.
• Confusionist posts are not allowed or tolerated.

• Proselytizing in any form is a particularly pernicious form of violence against others and is not tolerated. Whatever your beliefs, convictions or personal choices are, refrain yourself from imposing them on others.
• Content causing advertising nuisance will be subject to warning and/or deletion of content and/or account, without notice.
• Parody accounts as well as bots must imperatively mention it explicitly in the profile or will be deleted without notice.
• Cross posting is extremely badly perceived here, it's prohibited if automated.

• Publication here is in French or English (possibly in Spanish), we do not understand other languages and therefore cannot ensure moderation. Please choose an instance that can accommodate you properly.

• The use of cw is required for any content that could be perceived as offensive (nudity, pron, violence, blood, classic phobias, etc). If in doubt, it is best to put one on. If anyone asks you to, please remove the offending content and repost it with a cw.
Aquilenet applies on its instance a code of conduct. Every member of the instance has to respect it so we can get along together. Thank you for takind the time to read it.
Moreover, any content manifestly illegal (based on the french and european laws) or advertising will be punished.

If an instance refuses its moderation duty and if our moderation team estimates the risk of harassment, insult towards our members, or objectionable content diffusion is too big, they can decide to silence (don'

column1: The team running this Mastodon server is committed to bring you the best possible experience of Mastodon, we do this with top quality renewable hosting, awesome Ko-Fi supporters and a dedicated administration and moderation team following sound rules. This server is hosted in Sweden and welcomes everyone following our rules and code of conduct, our users are primarily from Scandinavia.
If you have the means please consider supporting us on Ko-Fi
We expect all users of this service to adhere to our transparent rules and code of conduct.

If you represent a commercial entity and are looking for a Mastodon-server for your brand and organization, we recommend you turn to our very skilled partners and consider their Mastodon hosting solutions here.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.nu, they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:
<li>The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline: &nbsp
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
<li>Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions&nbsp
• Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
<li>The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service: &nbsp
<li>Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof &nbsp
• Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health
<li>The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service: &nbsp
• Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

<li>Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors: &nbsp

<li>Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed. &nbsp

column2: s demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment. &nbsp

column1: • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user&apos
column2: s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

column3: is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

column1: Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted.
Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

• The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

This Mastodon server is hosted and moderated without annoying ads or selling any data, any donation will go a long way to keeping the lights on. There are several methods to choose from, we recommend Ko-Fi and a recurring plan since it helps us cover the recurring costs and gives us tools to give back to supporters in the form of behind the scenes content and helpful tips.

For information about Mastodon and how to use it, the documentation section of joinmastodon.org is a great place to start.
To report bugs or issues with the Mastodon software, or to suggest features/improvements, go to the Mastodon projects page on GitHub.
For any questions about the mastodon.scot server send an email to trumpet@mastodon.scot or visit our helpdesk (free registration required).
We have a page showing uptime and server status at status.mastodon.scot

We run mastodon.scot as a free service because we love Mastodon, but it costs us lots of money! If you'd like to donate towards our running costs you can contribute by buying Trumpet a donut. Or lots of donuts! Trumpet loves donuts.
Moderation of this server is carried out by our volunteer moderators on a best-efforts basis, based on interpretation of content posted to the server against our published rules.
Our server block list is based on but not identical to the Tier 0 blocklist.

PLEASE READ BEFORE JOINING:

mastodon.art is a safe space instance. We have strict federation policies that protect our most vulnerable members first and foremost, which means we block any instances that host or platform hate (racism, transphobia, etc.).

Mastodon‚Ä¢ART ‚Äî an inclusive community for creators that prioritises the safety of our marginalised members. We welcome all kinds of creativity: illustration, design, 3D modelling, gamedev, photography, music, writing, performance art, ceramics, typography, sculpture, fibre arts, and more! You're welcome to make ‚Ä¢ART your main home on the Fediverse and are welcome to go 'off topic' to post your daily thoughts, witty banter, and friendly communication.

Please read ‚Ä¢ART's Code of Conduct (below) and terms of use before signing up. Click here for a list of suggested Mastodon mobile apps. We strive to make ‚Ä¢ART a safe and supportive community for everyone with a strong zero-tolerance stance on hate and bigotry. ‚Ä¢ART has no ads or algorithms to mess with chronological timelines, and doesn't track you or profit off your data. Brands wishing to make an account here must be respectful by engaging with the local community. Accounts made solely to advertise will be suspended.

‚Ä¢ART is run by members of the community and is not a company trying to profit off of your life and art with ads. As such, your support via LiberaPay, Ko-Fi or Patreon to help pay for hosting and operating costs is greatly appreciated.

Mastodon.ART (‚Ä¢ART) is an independent community-run instance and is not affiliated with the joinMastodon.org (tootsuite) organization. The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administrators and moderators of ‚Ä¢ART. They are listed here to provide you with an insight into the site and our moderation policies.
.ART's emoji credits can be found
L.J. would like to direct supporters here instead:
> Support links for Indigenous disabled game dev & graphic designer evel:
> Support links for Black disabled artist Moo:

• The following is not allowed on ‚Ä¢ART: Unapproved bots, username squatting, registrations of famous trademarks/names (unless proof of identity is given). To be certain that your account isn't removed due to inactivity, be sure to upload an avatar and post at least once. Accounts without avatars or any activity may be deleted to free up registration space on the instance.

• Do not use ‚Ä¢ART as a permanent back up or repository for your information, statuses, or media. Please keep an original copy of your work on your local machine, as Mastodon downsizes large file sizes. We cannot guarantee perpetual storage of your toots, information, or media on our servers. Please make a periodic local backup of your account to safeguard against possible data loss.

• You may move your account to another instance at any time by using the ""Move to a different account"" setting at the bottom of your Edit Profile page in your Preferences. You can also export your follow and block lists from the Import & Export page and import them into your new account to make the transition easier.

• You may delete your account at any time using the ""Delete account"" option at the bottom of the Edit Profile page. Keep in mind that federation of your statuses to other servers or search engines is beyond ‚Ä¢ART's control ‚Äî statuses, media and federated copies of your profile may remain elsewhere. Deleting your account is permanent, cannot be undone, and your username/content cannot be reinstated.

• We block or suspend many instances that do not adhere to ‚Ä¢ART's ToS and CoC. Also, instances are intermittently and temporarily silenced during report investigations or when other instance moderators are not monitoring their users for any of the behaviours against our ToS/CoC.
• Please support the community by regularly boosting and positively interacting with other members.
• Mastodon.ART has a LiberaPay Account, a Ko-Fi and a Patreon if you'd like to support the operation and maintenance of our artistic community.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of Mastodon.ART. These guidelines are here to provide you with an insight into the site and moderation policies because all members are guests here.
See our Cultural Appropriation Policy for handling reports of cultural appropriation in creative works on .art.
• All users, local and remote, are expected to adhere to the following principles:

column2: s work, you must credit the original artist/author, and must include some form of analysis or opinion on the work posted.

column1: • Posting the same or similar content on multiple different instances (Fediverse servers) in order to spam local and/or federated timelines is not permitted.

column2: boundaries. Be respectful and sincerely apologize if someone informs you that a boundary has been crossed. Give people space if you accidentally push past a boundary.

column1: • If you find yourself involved in a conflict and are worried about the situation escalating, contact @Curator or any of the mods listed above.

• Tag sensitive content such as violence/blood, graphic nudity, lewd content, and other potentially upsetting or triggering topics and hide them under a Content Warning (CW). CWs are a big part of the culture of the Fediverse, and CWing potentially upsetting content is how we keep our community and the wider Fediverse safe and supportive for everyone. (We also recommend people CW political posts, but we will not mandate it.)
• All users, local and remote, will be considered in the wrong if they participate in the following:
• Demanding education on problematic behaviour from a non-admin/moderator
• Skirting the lines of being a troll, or directly trolling
• Sharing DM screenshots or quotes from DMs or private communications publicly without all parties'
• Creating memes about someone without their permission
• Ranting or engaging in long rambling tangents on public timelines about a particular user without explicitly naming them (also known as "
• Not tagging potentially sensitive or triggering toots
This is not an exhaustive list, and all moderation decisions are ultimately left up to the discretion of our mod team. If any of these don'
column2: t make sense, please speak with anyone on the mod team. We are more than happy to help you understand the problems with these kinds of behaviours.

column1: • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
• Corporate advertising and spam (does not include sharing links to your art-related income sites! You are allowed and encouraged to share your shop links, commissions info, donation sites, etc.)
• Unapproved news bots, post bots or follow bots
• Untagged/non-content-warned sensitive content (violence, gore, sexually explicit, etc.)

• The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service (please also note that .art does not allow those known for harassing marginalised people off-platform to have an account on .art):
• Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof

column2: discrimination against those who are neurodivergent, physically disabled, or mentally ill

column1: • Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or advocation thereof
• The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
• Sexual depictions of minors, real or fictional
• Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
• Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
• ‚Ä¢ART has a zero-tolerance mandate for harassment or bullying ‚Äî your account will be immediately suspended.

• Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from using the service, degrade the performance of the service, or incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

• Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.

column2: s demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called &quot

column1: • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called "
column5: ) may be considered harassment.

column1: • Please do not flood the local timeline. We define "
column3: as posting mutliple posts in quick succession to the local/public timeline (but the definition is flexible
column4: judgements on flooding will be made in context). Flooding drowns out other users and annoys instances we federate with.

column1: <ul><li>You can reply to the toots of others and banter back and forth as much as you want, as replies aren&#39
column2: t shown on the local/public timelines.

column1: <li>Please avoid posting many pieces of art/media all at once. Sticking to one post per ten minutes (with one-four pictures attached) is a good baseline to follow. Please respect others&#39
column2: content and statuses so that they can discover other artists in the local timeline.
d like to post long threads of many toots, consider marking the first toot as &quot

column6: . This will allow users to click through the first toot to read the rest of the thread without flooding the local/public timelines.

column2: s considered good form to put nudity behind a CW as a courtesy for other users in the fediverse at large, and we encourage this practice. Recognizing the subjectivity of the matter, we consider this a recommendation rather than a hard rule where very light nudity with no genitalia showing is concerned, and we will approach any reports or complaints on a case-by-case basis.

column1: • Illustrative nudity and body/anatomy studies with very visible genitalia, and titillating / erotic imagery intended for mature audiences, are allowed on ‚Ä¢ART, but only if tagged appropriately (ex. #lewd, #nudity, etc.) and marked as sensitive or placed under a descriptive content warning.
• Tags are required so people have the opportunity to filter such content from their timelines altogether.
• Descriptive text is required so that people can make an informed decision about whether to engage with the content behind the CW/image blur.

column2: re unsure whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning, consider the following hypothetical questions: Is it something you&#39
column3: d be comfortable viewing in a white collar work situation? Is it something you&#39
column4: d be comfortable being viewed by a minor? Would you happily show it to your parents? A no to any of these questions may require it being CWed/marked as sensitive. If you&#39
column5: re still unsure, marking it as sensitive/CWing it is a good bet.

column1: <li>Another way to decide whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning is to remember the <strong>Three B&#39
column2: s: If your work features any Boobs, Butts, or Bits (genitals), hide that sucker!

column1: <li>Loli or sexual content with characters of questionable age, as well as &#39
column3: characters from fandoms that are minors in order to depict them in sexual situations, is expressly prohibited ‚Äî your account will be suspended. (This includes cub porn.)

column1: • Nude photographs are only allowed if done in an artistic spirit ‚Äî however, it still needs to be tagged and CWed/marked as sensitive. Erotic photography, pornography, or photography that puts too much emphasis on the genitals is not allowed, even if marked "
• We understand that these things are subjective, but final interpretation of these rules are up to our moderation team.
• Gore, vore, and blood violence must also be placed under a descriptive content warning or marked sensitive.
• No NFT content. No advertising NFTs, no selling NFTs, no linking to off-platform NFTs or NFT content, no images connected to NFTs.
• AI-generated imagery (images generated by a neural network that has been trained using other people'
column2: s work without their consent) is not allowed at all. Sharing links to external articles discussing AI imagery is fine, but if the article will place a preview of an AI-generated image in your toot, please place it behind a content warning.

s administration team reserves the right to refuse service to anyone, as well as to remove your data at any time due to inactivity of any duration (to help against future unmonitored accounts from being hacked and becoming spam bots), unethical use, or usage against ‚Ä¢ART‚Äôs CoC/ToS. This includes repeatedly skirting the lines of rules in bad faith without explicitly crossing them, or without attempting to understand and respect the spirit in which these rules were written.

column1: All original content is copyrighted by the artist and cannot be distributed or used without prior permission by the artist. Do not repost or disseminate our artist'
column2: s original content anywhere without their express permission.

column1: Mastodon.art cares about your privacy and doesn'

column1: • Federating with Mastodon.ART is not guaranteed. Links between federated instances are temporary and may change or disappear at any time.
• Other instances may not disseminate our users'
column2: original content or toots without credit and proper licensing.

column1: • Other instances may not use automated means to analyze any derived work for publication or profit without ‚Ä¢ART'
column3: consent. This includes serving ads next to copyrighted content originally submitted on ‚Ä¢ART.

column1: • Public toots are derived works that are protected by copyright.
• This instance honours noindex/nofollow and search engines are not allowed to index content from such users.
• Crawling the content of the instance and creating a database of its posts and content for the purposes of archiving, searching, or analyzing is prohibited. We value our users'
column2: privacy and their ability to control how their data is utilized.

column1: • We will block, suspend, or silence any instance which permits any of the content or behaviour prohibited by this instance.
‚Ä¢ART is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host.

', 'No NFT content. None at all. There are crypto-related instances on the fediverse that would be more suitable. ', 'No AI-generated imagery allowed at all', 'No flooding the public timelines (making lots of public posts in quick succession).']"

58f44f4c762338151ee6dac2,kinky.business,False,13356,"

Hi! I'm @bedtimedrillsgt, a 30-something Dom. Beard and boobs enthusiast.
I built this Mastodon instance because there's plenty of room for fun sub-communities in the fediverse. And so, here is a home for all you kinky, filthy fucks.
Discuss your hopes and desires, post your latest toys or bruises and most of all, have fun.
If you have any questions or concerns, toot at me or send me an email.
First of all, a big fat spank you to our generous Patrons on Patreon. kinky business is made possible by filthy, generous people like you!

Want to be on this list too? Become a patron and support kinky.business! Running this server also costs money, quite a bit. If you enjoy it here, please consider contributing to the cost of the site by pledging a small monthly contribution. I appreciate it!
Ironically, kinky.business is not a business. I am doing this for fun, not profit, with no guarantees whatsoever. I will however keep this running for as long as I can.
Please adhere to the server rules at the bottom of this page at all times.
Feel free to report users or content that should not be here.
Admins of this site reserve the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
This is a regularly federated instance. Keep in mind that CW/NSFW tags are necessary not to get blocked by other servers.
Be thoughtful of the people who might be reading / seeing your content on their federated timelines.
We import a number of custom emoji, for instance Mutant Standard by Dzuk (CC by-nc-sa), thank you to the creators!
,kinky.business is a Mastodon instance for the kink community. Safe, sane, consensual.

MSTDN+ is a general-purpose instance open to everyone!
Note: NSFW content is prohibited on this instance. Alternatively you may use mstdn.party.

This instance is generously supported by our contributors, if you use this instance to interact with the Mastodon network please make a monthly contribution on Open Collective, all support is immensely helpful!

MSTDN+ is operated by Fediverse Communications LLC, a Minnesota (USA) company, and is hosted on servers operated in Germany and Finland. All content on this server is expected to be legal in all of these jurisdictions. If you have any copyright, trademark, legal concerns, please email us directly.

58fd6992c0b12e17d56bb66e,mastodon.sdf.org,False,72919,"

https://mastodon.sdf.org is a an open and federated instance.
It began life as a StatusNet instance in 2010 and was converted to Mastodon in May 2017.

Daily maintenance window is from 0500 - 0700 UTC. During this time the instance may be unavailable. In the event that there is extended maintenance, please see https://mastodon.sdf.org/status.html for details as well as history.
We host a daily VoIP chat/improv on (929)299-1269 0200 UTC
A few of our members are artists/DJs and have shows on https://aNONradio.net
OpenMIC is open to all daily between 0300-0600 UTC
We host a weekly Amateur Radio NET Mondays at 0000 UTC echolink TECHLINK node 9229
Are you fun and creative? Join us!

Mathstodon.xyz is a Mastodon instance for people who love maths.
This instance is for people who love maths and we hope there‚Äôll be lots of maths chat, but any topic of conversation following the code of conduct and the principle of getting along together is OK.
You can use LaTeX in toots here! Use \( and \) for inline, and \[ and \] for display mode.

LaTeX is only rendered in the web interface, and not on all Mastodon instances. If the layout of your LaTeX code isn't too complicated, you can replace it with unicode characters by clicking the preview rendering below the post entry area before writing the closing delimiter.
If you'd like to contribute towards the running costs of mathstodon.xyz, you can send us some money through Ko-Fi, either as a one-off or recurring payment.
If you'd like to show your support for mathstodon.xyz in real life, you can buy a t-shirt featuring our lovable mascot.
If you want to run your own instance with LaTeX rendering
The forked version of Mastodon that this instance runs is available at github.com/christianp/mastodon.
We‚Äôre keen to make sure that Mathstodon is great for everyone.
Users violating the server's rules may have their accounts suspended and will not be welcome to take part any more.
If you are subject to or observe any harassment, or have any other concerns, please report the toot concerned or message a moderator. Reports will be dealt with discreetly and in confidence.
Please be aware of your surroundings and the effect your words and actions have on the people around you. We want everyone to have a great time, and treat each other with respect.
There's a wiki at wiki.mathstodon.xyz. When the service is unavailable, check the status page.

Please mind that the staff@mastodon.social e-mail is for inquiries related to the operation of the mastodon.social server specifically. If your account is on another server, we will not be able to assist you. For inquiries not related specifically to the operation of this server, such as press inquiries about Mastodon gGmbH, please contact press@joinmastodon.org. Additional addresses:
This server is crowdfunded by Patreon donations. For a list of sponsors, see joinmastodon.org.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.
We have a team of paid moderators. If you would like to become a moderator, get in touch with us through the e-mail address above.

Targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called &quot
Harassing people in any way, racism, sexism or transphobia is strictly forbidden.</br>

column3: / pedophile spreading pictures of minors will get you erased and reported to authorities.</br>

column1: Accounts mainly used for spam, porn, advertisements or backlinking are immediatly deleted.</br>
Do not break german law (no nazis or extremists allowed).</br>
Do not post erotic content without content warning.</br>
Do not spread explicit pictures or copyrighted material.</br>
This instance is strongly focused on user privacy, we save no IP(changing your IP with 127.0.0.1 before it gets sent to Mastodon), are accessible via tor and yggdrasil and use no cloudflare.</br>
We use an hilarious amount of serverpower to provide the best possible experience, please let us know of any speed shortcomings.</br>
Free speech is a precious good, but it has its limits.</br>
We ban bigots, racists, terfs and users that break german or international laws, objections are denied in these cases.</br>
Our strongest core value is to be a safe place for everyone, if we notice any kind of harassment coming from or going towards our instances,</br>
the offending accounts are suspended without parole.</br></br>
We use the latest security technology to prevent sensitive data from being accessed from the outside with systems like CrowdSec and implementing the latest TLS standards.
This includes not using Cloudflare at all as this would jeopardize your privacy as a huge MITM attack vector.</br>
A sophisticated anti-ddos filter from CDN77 in addition to the well known Arbor Networks filter nullify most attacks.</br>
Daily full backups of the database and a daily incremental backup of media files are being made towards a different datacenter within Frankfurt.</br></br>

Another main goal is showcasing how fast mastodon can be by deploying it on the best highest clocking machine money can buy in a one of a kind european datacenter with active-active routing, the usage of CDN77s vast network and using a webserver which enables the latest webtechnologies like http/3, CASPer and quic (h2o).</br></br>

The h2o webserver does not create any logs, Mastodon is being given a false IP (127.0.0.1) and we have a tor hidden service address with https enabled and a valid certificate from harica. Also accessible via Yggdrasil Network. These require acceptance of the tor onion cert. Also an early supporter of WirSpeichernNicht (german for WeDontStore), a movement against the data retention law that was planned earlier in Germany, pledging not to make logs.
Whatever comes up as features at Mastodon, we implement it, we want you to have the best Mastodon experience there is, this includes:</br>

Full Text Search via ElasticSearch, Translation Service via LibreTranslate and a relay service via AodeRelay, besides some relays, crowdsec and netdata, both very heavy focused on data privacy, no external services are being used.</br></br>
The service is online since may 8th, 2017 and is here to stay, also thanks to the continuous support from our community.</br></br>
This instance is hosted at SYNLINQ which houses the servers in the modern maincubes FRA01 datacenter which only uses green energy and energy efficient cooling like the kyoto wheel. </br></br>
<b>Threads.net is blocked via domain block and iptables drop as the company has a horrendous past and does not at all align with our idea of privacy and safety.</br>
Bridgy is blocked, as we do not want to rely on such services and rather promote using compatible standards.
Bots are fine as long as they are useful
Impressum/Imprint and Datenschutz/Data Security information in german
The server acts according to the Mastodon Server Covenant
Unfortunately ieji.de has issues on delivery towards these instances because we were suspended:</br>
AMD Ryzen 9 7950X 16-Core 5.5GHz, 128GB DDR5-4800 RAM, 2x4TB PCIE4 NVME(PM9A3), 10Gbps Mellanox connect x3 pro nic, premium active-active networking, SYNLINQ Frankfurt, Germany</br>
For running ieji.de, rel.re, libretranslate.de and other services</br>
BorgBase BorgBackup space in the EU: $15/m</br>
Now that you know the price for stellar performance,</br>
feel free to support ieji.de if you enjoy the service
(split up, please put the lines together)</br>
Via Cash sent to the address shown here
Donations which exceed the monthly service costs are paid towards digitalcourage e.V. and netzpolitik.org e.V. equally.</br>

column2: >Metalhead.club is a microblogging platform - A place where you can exchange short posts with like-minded people about metal and rock or other topics that excite you.

column1: You can follow other users or specific #hashtags to stay up to date on your favorite topics. Numerous filter options allow you to hide content that you don't like.
metalhead.club is part of the decentralized Mastodon network - from here you can also exchange with any other users from the network - no matter on which server they have their account.
On metalhead.club we are mainly connected by our taste in music - but of course you can also discuss other topics

We are especially proud of the fact that we cover the costs for the technical infrastructure by voluntary contributions - completely without advertising, without selling your data or making crooked deals. A part of the users keeps the project running for everyone.
Our entire infrastructure is powered exclusively by green electricity, so we don't harm the environment unnecessarily.

column2: >Curious? Just try it out and register an account for free!

column1: This instance is run by Leister IT and 100 % funded by its users. It could not exist without financial contributions by the members. If you like this place, consider participating in the funding of this server. More information about donations: donate.650thz.de
Metalhead.club server is run and provided voluntarily. There are some rules to make living together peacefully possible. You accept these rules by creating an account on this server.
In general German law applies to this instance, since the service is run in a german datacenter. Violation of these laws will be prosecuted. Additionally the server rules apply.
The provider of this service will remove content at his own discretion if it does not suit a free, peaceful and tolerant world. In this case, the author of the concerning content will be notified.
Downloading user posts from this instance for the purpose of AI training is prohibited.

We've teamed up with Fastly to provide both CDN and DDoS mitigation to our users, improving both performance and uptime.
Huge thanks to the team at Fastly for supporting Fosstodon.

The code of conduct at Fosstodon can be simply summarised as ""don't be a jerk"". However, if you need more detail as to what we consider unacceptable behaviour, please take a look at our code of conduct.
If you enjoy your time on Fosstodon and want to support what we're doing here, you can do so in a number of ways. To find out how, use the link below:
We have created a mini-site called the Fosstodon Hub. It contains useful information about Fosstodon in the form of a blog.

One of the issues with a federated social network like Mastodon is users need to be sure their instance isn‚Äôt going to disappear overnight. This has happened a number of occasions we've seen, and we want to ease your mind in that regard should you choose Fosstodon.

5a0cc2d229997d117543014c,tech.lgbt,False,13861,"

Please visit our info site at https://info.tech.lgbt/ for more detailed instance information.
>*Due to increased bot signup, manual approval is required. Please
write some applicable request text on signup with why you want to
join. Submissions that fail to do so will be denied.*</em

We welcome all marginalized identities. We are explicitly anti-racist, anti-queerphobic, and anti-transphobic. This Mastodon instance is generally for folks who are LGBTQIA+ and Allies with an interest in tech work, academics, or technology in general.
tech.lgbt uses a modified version of glitch-soc, a fork of Mastodon.
In addition to this fork, we have made a variety of customizations for our instance, including:
• Increasing max results in the emoji searcher (web interface)
• An increase in the media proxy API endpoint rate limit, so that when you're scrolling through someone's media tab on their page, all the media will properly load
Our repository of customizations can be found at https://github.com/techlgbt/techlgbt
This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji,
Baba emoji by @ShadowJonathan, adapted from assets from the .
rel=""nofollow noopener"">PICMO, gifted to the server for free by the creator.
rel=""nofollow noopener"">Eppa. Miffy by Dick Bruna
We try to handle moderation ASAP, but we may not see reports for several
hours. We will get to all reports though!
We're not a free speech absolutist, and there are instances available for
that. We're not interested in Nazis, TERFS, or hate speech of any sort,
which we will define at our sole discretion as moderators. No homophobia,
This instance is meant to be a friendly, welcoming space to all who are
willing to reciprocate in helping to create that environment.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation
is up to the administration of tech.lgbt
column2: they are here to provide you with

column1: an insight into our content moderation policies:
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content,
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline,
and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result
in revocation of access to the service:
Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust
• Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other
users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the
service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform
any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to
punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This
includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has
specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to
cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's
demographic, personal, or private data without express
permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction
or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement
with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading
or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves
the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any
reason, except as limited by law.
Our Content Warning (CW) policy is intended to make our server comfortable
for our community. We are not trying to silence our community or police
discussion, but ask that you consider those who may read your posts when
Content Warnings are a feature of Mastodon that enable you to hide the body
of a ""toot"" (post) behind a line of text. The intended use of this feature
is to provide a way to discuss sensitive and/or potentially harmful topics
without causing duress or harm to anyone who might stumble upon it, though
content warnings may be used for a wide variety of reasons.
Images can be marked as sensitive. This is a feature which hides an image
until a warning banner is clicked. Images may be marked as sensitive
separately from Content Warnings, though using a Content Warning
automatically marks the toot's images as sensitive.

Please note that our sensitive media rules apply to profile photos and headers as well. Since those images cannot be hidden behind sensitive media warnings, they are not allowed to contain content from enforced content warnings.
We cannot enforce content warnings on users from other instances, but can
help to manage content that you see when reported to instance moderators.
Please be clear and accurate when labeling content warnings, to ensure that
they follow both the letter and spirit of the enforcements that we have.
Above all, try to be polite, and come from a place of mutual respect
when discussing content warnings with other. We do not condone tone
policing, and want to promote healthy discussion in our community.
This cannot ever be a complete list, and so we want to keep it semi-general,
and reserve the right to use the judgement of the moderation team to make
NSFW/sexual discussion and imagery must be behind descriptive
Sensitive imagery (please use your best judgement on what
content that most other users would find sensitive, such as
photos of surgeries, abuse, war, deceased individuals, etc)
Discussion of overtly political (relating to elected or
Triggering topics (direct discussion of rape, trauma, abuse,
suicide, transphobia, homophobia, etc). The intention is to
provide a warning for users who may not want to consume this
content, not to silence users who are sharing their negative
• ""Rage"" posts and posts using mainly capital letters
We do not allow the promotion, advertisement, or sale of cryptocurrencies on
our instance. Mentioning the existence of cryptocurrencies, linking personal
accounts or addresses, and otherwise discussing them in a way that is not
intended to sell or advertise a specific cryptocurrency is acceptable. We do
not have any association with any cryptocurrency or other monetary
transactions that happen within the server.
We do not allow the promotion, advertisement, or sale of NFTs on our
instance. We do not allow content from our instance, including content and
media uploaded by our community members, to be sold as NFTs.
This instance is administered by the team of:
Moderation support is provided by the hard working team of:
If you would like to directly contact our moderation team, we have an account at @mods, and can be reached via email at mods@tech.lgbt

As required by the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (17 U.S.C. 512 (c)), all notifications of copyright infringement regarding content hosted on tech.lgbt should be sent ONLY to its designated agent.
This instance is funded in part by
We maintain a blocklist of instances that we do not federate with. If you
believe that an instance should be added to this list, please contact an

>For privacy and safety of our community, we do not comment on most instance blocks that we have in place. We have recently begun sharing details on major/oft commented moderation decisions via @mods@tech.lgbt
The list is visible for logged-in members under the section

Moderated servers below. While we understand that not publishing this list for non-members is not fully transparent, we are not trying to scare off potential new members who want to ensure that their friends are not blocked. The only nefarious intent here are those who have used this information when public to harass individuals and the instance as a whole. Bluntly, if those are the people that you want to interact with, you should probably join their instance instead.
This page most recently updated on 4 June 2024

• Ë∞¢Áªù Êó†ÊÑè‰πâÂà∑Â±èÔºåÂπøÂëäÊé®ÈÄÅ Á±ªÁî®Êà∑Ê≥®ÂÜå‰ΩøÁî®
    Discourage meaningless spamming, advertising, and solicitation.
    New user registrations for such purposes are not welcome.
Personal avatars and profile banners must not contain NSFW images.
The text limit per post is 20,000 characters.
However, any public long posts must be folded using &quot
Please do not abuse the instance&#39
such as linking images or videos externally.
Strict measures against child pornography are in place.
Accounts found engaging will be banned and deleted.
Posting anime-style lolicon images is permitted,
but real-life child pornography is strictly prohibited.
If operating a bot for image sharing,
you must mark sensitive content, including regular images.
A first violation of the above rules will result in the user being hidden,
and upon a second report, the user account will be suspended.
all user data will be permanently deleted after three days.
Media stored on wasabi(us-west-1) with Cloudflare.
the closure of the site will be announced three months in advance.
We do not have DDoS protection nor SLA guarantees,
but we strive to maintain online availability as much as possible.
If a user on wxw.moe uses copyrighted content without authorization,
the copyright owner can send a DMCA takedown notice to abuse@wxw.moe to request the modification or removal of the infringing content.
Users who repeatedly violate this policy will be suspended and permanently deleted.
