column1: C.IM is a general, mainly English-speaking Mastodon community.
We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. A number of instance blocks are implemented to comply with the principles of the covenant.
Our goal is to provide a long-term fediverse platform for everyone to share their thoughts, ideas and lifestyles.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of c.im
column2: they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

column1: • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
• Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
• Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
• The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
• Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
• Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health

You are encouraged to share your personal experiences here. But in doing so, please do not engage in personal attacks or make broad statements that attack/offend others - simply because of who they are. proposal by @fallingbeam
• The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
• Content illegal in the Netherlands (where c.im is hosted) or the Isle of Man (where c.im domain is registered), including holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
• Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

• Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

• Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.

column2: s demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.

column1: • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user'
column2: s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

column1: You are welcome to join our own Lemmy instance R.NF and post any questions regarding C.IM here
We maintain our relay service at https://relay.c.im/. For Mastodon webmasters, you can add https://relay.c.im/inbox if you want to use our relay services.

Moderation of this instance is based on interpretation of content posted to the instance against our published rules. We do not have the ability to investigate content outside this instance. If you are concerned about content posted to other instances, please contact the administration of the instance.

Ein Ausschnitt aus den Regeln, an die wir uns auf dieser Instanz halten:

• Behandle andere respektvoll: Unterlasse jegliche Formen von Beleidigungen, Mobbing oder Diskriminierung, einschlie√ülich aber nicht ausschlie√ülich rassistischer, sexistischer, homophober, transphober, antisemitischer und frauenfeindlicher √Ñu√üerungen oder Handlungen gegen√ºber anderen Personen.
• Verwende einen angemessenen Tonfall: Verwende einen respektvollen und freundlichen Ton, auch wenn du mit jemandem uneinig bist.
• Respektiere die Privatsph√§re anderer: Teile keine pers√∂nlichen Informationen ohne ausdr√ºckliche Genehmigung und achte die Datenschutzrechte anderer.
• Halte dich an geltendes Recht: Ver√∂ffentliche keine illegalen Inhalte.
• Vermeide Falschinformationen: Teile keine falschen oder irref√ºhrenden Informationen.
• Keine Spam-Posts: Verzichte auf das Ver√∂ffentlichen unerw√ºnschter Werbung oder √§hnlicher Inhalte, die nicht zur Community passen.

• Kennzeichnung sensibler Inhalte (CW): Kennzeichne alle Inhalte, die allgemeine Ausl√∂ser enthalten, sexuell explizit oder gewaltt√§tig sind, als sensibel (CW), um die Sicherheit der anderen Mitglieder:innen zu gew√§hrleisten. Hinweis: Konten, die ausschlie√ülich solche Inhalte ver√∂ffentlichen, k√∂nnen eingeschr√§nkt oder gesperrt werden.
• Du musst √§lter als 16 Jahre sein: Nach europ√§ischem Recht musst du mindestens 16 Jahre alt sein, um diese Instanz zu nutzen.
Au√üerdem befolgen wir den Mastodon Server Covenant

Ungeachtet dieser Regeln beh√§lt sich die Moderation das Recht vor, aus beliebigen Gr√ºnden Posts zu l√∂schen oder einen Account zu blockieren. Dabei werden auch Inhalte auf anderen Webseiten (verlinkter Twitter/Blog) einbezogen.
Wenn du Verst√∂√üe gegen die Regeln feststellst oder dir nicht sicher bist, nutze die Melden Funktion, oder sende uns eine Email.
Bitte kontaktiere @main f√ºr support Anfragen.

Unterst√ºtze uns bei der Finanzierung der Server f√ºr diese Instanz, indem du eine Spende √ºber das Open Collective t√§tigst. Deine finanzielle Unterst√ºtzung ist willkommen, aber keine Voraussetzung, um diese Instanz zu nutzen.
A few rules we adhere to on this instance:

• Treat others with respect: Avoid any form of insult, bullying, or discrimination, including but not limited to racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, anti-Semitic, and misogynistic statements or actions against others.
• Use appropriate tone: Use a respectful and friendly tone, even if you disagree with someone.
• Respect privacy: Do not share personal information without explicit permission and respect the privacy rights of others.
• Comply with applicable law: Do not publish any illegal content.
• Avoid misinformation: Do not share false or misleading information.
• No spam posts: Refrain from publishing unwanted advertising or similar content that does not fit the community.

• Mark sensitive content: Please mark any content that may contain common triggers, is sexually explicit or violent as sensitive (CW) to ensure the safety of other members. Note: Accounts that exclusively post such content may be limited or banned.
• You must be older than 16 years: According to European law, you must be at least 16 years old to use this instance.
We also follow the Mastodon Server Covenant
Notwithstanding these rules, the moderation reserves the right to delete posts or block an account for any reason. This also includes content on other websites (linked Twitter/blog).
If you see any violations of the rules or are not sure if, use the report function, or send us an email.
Please contact @main for support requests.
Help us fund the servers for this instance by making a donation through the Open Collective. Your financial support is welcome, but not a requirement to use this instance.

This Code contains the rules and principles for participating in the Mastodon.world community. It is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document, so the Mastodon.world team may amend it from time to time.

• Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristic.
• Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each other‚Äôs successes.

• Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content and from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

• We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything that violates these rules or principles and remain a member of our community. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.

• The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want, if what you post follows these rules, principles and the goals outlined above. Not every member of the community will appreciate controversial or explicit posts so use Content Warnings very liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit.
• Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome in Mastodon.world. We will moderate accordingly.
• This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you choose to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.
The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.
General guidance on posting and participating in Mastodon.world

• Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about inflammatory subjects at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases, but it is never acceptable to post inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning.
• Do not post any type of nudity without a Content Warning.

• Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. If you are here only to sell your products or services, you will be removed. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when the vast majority of a user'
column2: s posts are commercial in nature, we regard the account as a Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case by case basis.

column1: • Do not engage in name calling, ad hominem attacks, or any other uncivil behaviour. Criticize ideas, never people.

• Misgendering, the act of referring to someone using a gender or pronouns that do not correctly reflect their gender identity, is prohibited. Deliberate or targeted misgendering, where there is an intentional refusal to respect an individual'
column2: s self-identified gender and pronouns, is considered a form of harassment and discrimination.

column1: • Deadnaming, which involves referring to a transgender or gender-diverse person by a name they used before their gender transition, is prohibited.

column3: or any related programs or practices is prohibited. Conversion therapy, which aims to change an individual‚Äôs sexual orientation or gender identity, is a discredited practice that is harmful and disrespectful to the LGBTQ+ community.

column1: • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful, or just don‚Äôt like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from mastodon.world when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times, or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in suspension of the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isn‚Äôt explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for Mastodon.world, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or otherwise are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the discretion of the moderation team, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.
Mastodon.world is run by @ruud, who also pays the bills.
Since the November 2022 user influx, those bills have gone up quite steeply.
For those who would like to contribute, the following options for donations are available:
The running costs of Mastodon currently consist of:
• Hetzner cloud VPS for monitoring, blog etc
Monthly updates about the finances can be found at our blog
You can view the status and uptime here
A special thank you to @vsp (Vincent) for creating the :mastodonworld: emoji, as well as the server image and the profile pictures for @mwadmin.

Wir m√∂chten eine freundliche, sichere und inklusive Mastodon-Instanz f√ºr alle Menschen bieten, die sich unseren Zielen und Hessen verbunden f√ºhlen. Hier m√∂chten wir eine Umgebung schaffen in der sich Menschen freundlich austauschen und diskutieren k√∂nnen, ohne pers√∂nlichen Angriffen oder Stigmatisierung ausgesetzt zu sein.

Um dieses Ziel so gut wie m√∂glich zu erreichen haben wir die folgenden Nutzungsbedingungen geschaffen, die wir auf dieser Instanz auch entsprechend umsetzen. Solltest du mit diesen Bedingungen nicht einverstanden sein, so m√∂chten wir dir nahe legen dir eine andere Instanz zu suchen.
Mastodon ist ein offenes soziales Netzwerk. Es basiert auf offenen Web-Protokollen und freier, quelloffener Software. Es ist dezentral (so wie E-Mail!).
Infos zu Mastodon findest du auf beispielsweise unter folgenden Links:
Falls du von Twitter kommst oder √ºberlegst zu wechseln k√∂nnen wir dir diesen Beitrag von contentnation.net ans Herz legen.
Tipps und Tricks gibt es u.a. hier:

F√ºr das Erstellen und den Betrieb eines Kontos auf diesem Mastodon-Server ist die Zustimmung zu den nachfolgenden Nutzungsbedingungen erforderlich. Die Moderation setzt diese Regeln aktiv durch. Nichtbeachtung kann verschiedene Ma√ünahmen wie einfache Ermahnungen, L√∂schung von Beitr√§gen, zeitweise/dauerhafte Sperrungen bis hin zur L√∂schung eines Kontos zur Folge haben.
Einige dieser Ma√ünahmen k√∂nnen auch bei Nutzer:innen anderer Instanzen erfolgen. Auch die Sperrung aller Inhalte anderer Instanzen ist m√∂glich.

Diese Instanz ist f√ºr den pers√∂nlichen Austausch nat√ºrlicher Nutzer:innen und der Pr√§sentation von Vereinigungen oder Organisationen mit Sitz in Hessen gedacht. Voll-automatisierte Accounts sind nicht gestattet. Das schlie√üt insbesondere Accounts ein, auf denen mit Automationswerkzeugen geposted, aber nie anders interagiert wird (Antworten, Boosten, etc.). Ausnahmen von dieser Regelung siehe ‚ÄûBots‚Äú.
Aktive Nutzer:innen d√ºrfen erg√§nzend Werkzeuge f√ºr automatisches Posten verwenden. (z.B. Crossposter).

Unser Angebot erfordert eine Zustimmung zu den Datenschutzrichtlinien. Gem√§√ü DSGVO ist dies nur Personen m√∂glich die das 16. Lebensjahr vollendet haben. Wenn du unter 16 Jahren bist, darfst du diese Plattform daher leider nicht benutzen.
• Sei immer freundlich und h√∂flich. Behandle andere mit Respekt.

• Bel√§stige und beleidige niemanden und unterlasse pers√∂nliche Angriffe.Weder allein noch als Gruppe. Das Ver√∂ffentlichen oder die Androhung von Ver√∂ffentlichung von personen-identifizierenden Informationen (""doxing"") wird als Bel√§stigung ausgelegt.
• Kontaktiere keine Nutzer:innen die angegeben haben, dass sie nicht kontaktiert werden m√∂chten.

• Die Nutzung oder Bef√ºrwortung von rassistischer, sexistischer, homophober, transphober, behindertenfeindlicher und anderweitig diskriminierender oder hasserf√ºllter Sprache bzw. verharmlosende oder guthei√üende Inhalte zu Wei√üer Vorherrschaft, Antisemitismus, Transphobie oder anderen hasserf√ºllten Ideologien wird nicht geduldet.
• Nochmal ganz deutlich: Wir dulden keine nationalistische Propaganda, keine Nazi-Symbolik und keine F√∂rderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus!
• Poste keine pornographischen oder sexualisierten Inhalte. Dazu geh√∂ren auch Witze und Kommentare.
• Halte dich an die in Deutschland geltenden Gesetze (verbietet u.a. auch gewaltverherrlichende Inhalte).

• Ver√∂ffentliche keinen Spam oder kommerzielle Werbung. Kommerzielle Werbung in diesem Zusammenhang bedeutet, wenn die ver√∂ffentlichten Inhalte keinen pers√∂nlichen Bezug aufweisen und eindeutig dazu gedacht sind, direkt oder indirekt Geld zu erwirtschaften.
Bei √∂ffentliche Toots m√ºssen zus√§tzlich die folgende Punkte beachtet werden:
Ver√∂ffentliche keine Inhalte √ºber kontroverse, aufr√ºhrerische oder triggernde Themen ohne eine Inhaltswarnung zu verwenden.

Dies gebietet bereits ein respektvoller Umgang. Dennoch m√∂chten wir nochmals betonen, dass unsachliche Diskussionsbeitr√§ge die der vors√§tzlichen Sch√§digung der Diskussion zur Folge haben unerw√ºnscht sind. Dazu z√§hlen bspw. auch Scheinargument-Attacken (auch ad hominem genannt) oder die Kritik an inklusiver Sprache, wenn diese nicht das Thema der Diskussion ist.

Diskutiere Moderationsentscheidungen nicht zuerst in √∂ffentlichen Toots. Wenn Du nicht einverstanden bist wie ein Moderation diese Bedingungen interpretiert und anwendet, dann kontaktiere uns. Schicke eine Mail an kontakt@hessen.social oder schreibe eine Direktnachricht an @moomendemol@hessen.social
Gefundene Fehler in der Software auf hessen.social sind umgehend zu melden.

Wenn dir hier ein Toot auff√§llt, der diesen Kodex verletzt, melde das bitte immer. Es ist gut m√∂glich, dass jemand anderes diesen Inhalt bereits gemeldet hat. Allerdings passiert es schnell, dass alle so denken und es am Ende niemand meldet.
Spezielle Bot-Accounts sind erlaubt, soweit sie die nachfolgenden Bedingungen erf√ºllen.
• Es gelten die gleichen Regelungen wie f√ºr alle anderen Accounts.
• Es muss eine erreichbare Kontaktperson in der Beschreibung des Bots in einem Tabellenfeld 'Kontaktperson' zu finden sein.
• Die Profilbeschreibung muss einen kurzen Text √ºber den Sinn und Zweck des Bots enthalten.
• Bots d√ºrfen lediglich Nicht gelistet posten, um mehr Raum f√ºr relevantere, lokale Inhalte zu bieten.
• Ausnahmen von diesen Regelungen sind nach Absprache m√∂glich.
Aufgrund von zunehmenden Spamaccounts wurde die Nutzung von Wegwerfmailadressen und h√§ufigen Spammerdomains unterbunden (siehe auch n√§chsten Abschnitt zu gmail.com).
Die gesperrten Domains finden sich hier: https://github.com/disposable-email-domains/disposable-email-domains
Sollte sich in dieser Liste eine Domain befinden die ihr selber nutzt und dort als falsch erachtet, k√∂nnt ihr
1. unter dem o.g. Link ein Issue er√∂ffnen um die Domain von der Sperrliste zu nehmen
2. falls 1. nicht klappt oder nicht m√∂glich ist, uns eine Mail schreiben um eine lokale Ausnahme zu erstellen.
Nach zwei Wochen Betrieb zeigt sich bereits, dass von Maildomains mit der Endung ""@gmail.com"" eine enorme Menge Spamaccounts angelegt werden. Daher ist die Domain ab sofort gesperrt.

Wenn du eine Google-Adresse nutzen willst, dann ersetze @gmail.com einfach durch @googlemail.com, das funktioniert auch. Alternativ kannst du nat√ºrlich auch eine andere Mailadresse nehmen, am besten von einem Mailprovider der deine Mailinhalte nicht durchforstet und zu Werbezwecken nutzt.

Wir behalten uns vor, Nutzeraccounts, die keine Aktivit√§t zeigen, zu l√∂schen. Die Aktivit√§t wird unter anderem am letzten Login und der Tootaktivit√§t festgemacht. So fallen bspw. Accounts die 3 Monate ohne Login sind und noch nie etwas getootet haben unter diese Regelung.

Bei der Nutzung des Angebots findet deutsches Recht Anwendung. Gerichtsstand ist Darmstadt. Die Nutzung erfolgt ausschlie√ülich freiwillig. Die Nutzung des Dienstes kann von den Betreiber:innen ohne Angabe von Gr√ºnden untersagt werden.
• Aktive Moderation gegen Rassismus, Homophobie und Transphobie
Wir erstellen t√§gliche automatische und verschl√ºsselte externe Backups
• Mindestens eine weitere Person mit (Notfall)Zugang zur Serverinfrastruktur
• Zusicherung, dass User mindestens drei Monate im Voraus benachrichtigt werden, falls der Dienst eingestellt werden sollte

Wir behalten uns das Recht vor diesen Dienst jederzeit einzustellen. Nach Bekanntgabe versichern wir aber eine √úbergangszeit von mindestens 3 Monaten um etwaige Daten zu sichern und einen Account-Umzug durchzuf√ºhren zu k√∂nnen.

Sicherheit, Integrit√§t und Datenschutz sind Maxime die wir bei hessen.social umgesetzt haben. Unser Ziel ist es daher nicht nur den rechtlichen Vorgaben wie der Datenschutz-Grundverordnung (kurz ""DSGVO"") zu gen√ºgen, sondern bei der notwendigen Verarbeitung von personenbezogenen Daten die maximal technisch m√∂gliche Datensparsamkeit zu erreichen. Ganz ohne Datenverarbeitung geht es aber nicht. Welche Daten wir verarbeiten und ewarum findest du in unserer Datenschutzerkl√§rung

Der Betrieb von hessen.social und das zugeh√∂rige Monitoring und Backup kostet uns Geld. Die Nutzung von hessen.social wird immer kosten- und werbefrei bleiben. Anstatt uns aber Geld f√ºr den Betrieb dieses Servers zu zahlen, gebt doch lieber Geld an das Computerwerk. Daf√ºr gibt es auch eine Spendenquittung :)
Vielen Dank an die Fediverse-Community und insbesondere @w4tsn von darmstadt.social, der uns beim Einstieg unterst√ºtzt hat :)

Mindly.Social aims to be a friendly, non-topic specific community focused on spreading positivity, expanding your knowledge and experiences, and just being plain old happy on social media for once.
Click this link for more in-depth Mindly.Social info

(At this time we are an English only server due to various reasons including the inability to moderate posts in languages we do not speak, being unable to fairly moderate and handle reports is unfair to other servers and our users.)

Mindly.Social is designed to be a positive, inspirational, and educational community with a focus on bettering each other and yourself. This might seem like a pipe dream on the internet but maybe it will work out, who knows right?

Unsolicited spam is not allowed. This includes creating an account for the sole purpose of posting company/brand advertisements, affiliate/referral links, donation/fundraising links, or any other method of requestion money from others. Corporate/brand accounts are not allowed.
Continuous posting of content or reposting of external content within a short time without intent of engaging in a conversation is not allowed.
We require all users to properly use Content Warnings (CW) when posting about sensitive, divisive, inflammatory, or upsetting topics and content. These topics include, but are not limited to:
All bot accounts must have the ""This is a bot account"" box in the profile settings. Any accounts displaying signs of being a bot or strictly posting automated content will be limited or suspended.

While we do allow the discussion of current events and news, accounts found to only be posting links to external news sources without providing any commentary or attempting to start a discussion will be limited or suspended.
Posting external news links to articles directly related to you (i.e. you are the subject, author, or have some involvement in the article) is allowed.
First and foremost, this community is designed to be a place for discussion so solely reposting news links is not allowed and may also violate our Bots/Automated Content policy above.

We all have rough days/weeks/months/years, it's okay to rant and vent about life here. It's not always going to be unicorns and rainbows and we understand that. When we say positivity we mean towards each other. As long as you're not complaining about or attacking an individual or group, you're probably fine. üòâ

Like everywhere else in the world there's going to be arguments and disagreements, heck there will even be people who just can't get along and that's fine. You're not required to agree with or like everybody you meet. We encourage debates and discussions about topics, not individuals or persons. So, if you do want to argue or disagree, keep the personal attacks out of it. Thank you.

Please consider adding alternative text (alt text) to any images you post to allow better access to your discussions for all users. For an excellent overview of alt text please check out this thread by JesseF8693, one of our extremely helpful and informative users.
We abide by the Mastodon Server Covenant
With this being the internet there's bound to be a few bad apples in every bunch, Mastodon is no different. Due to this unfortunate truth, we may find the need to block problematic instances.
+ Dzuk's free emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
Sew icons created by Freepik - Flaticon
Chocolate-milk icons created by 2D3ds - Flaticon
Greyhound icons created by Freepik - Flaticon
CDN by CloudFlare + Backblaze
To help cover the costs of the servers we have setup the following methods to allow the community to contribute to help keeping things running smoothly as we continue to grow.
These rules below are pretty simple and straight forward. I don't want to make them complex or detailed so please use common sense and be a good person (online and IRL).

,Mindly.Social is an English speaking, friendly Mastodon instance created for people who want to use their brains and their hearts to make social networking more social. üß†üíñ",Mindly.Social,,,True,"[{'id': '1', 'text': 'Be nice to everybody always. (Individual self-promotion is allowed.)'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'English only. Due to the issues with moderating other languages, please stick to English posts/media on this server.'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'No users under 13 years of age.'}]","['Be nice to everybody always. column3: > is a Mastodon instance for Canadians and is administered and hosted in Canada.

column2: >A reminder that you can support the ongoing maintenance of mstdn.ca. This instance is run by volunteers and it needs your help to continue. All proceeds go directly to server costs. You&rsquo
column3: ll find the most updated breakdown of costs here.

column2: >Check out the latest mstdn.ca news on our blog
>Having issues with mstdn.ca? Check our status page

>We accept registrations from any person aged 18+. Our user base is primarily based in Canada, and our moderation team members are fluent in either English, French, or both. While we do not require the use of any particular language, moderators may use automated translation services to spot-check posts and ensure adherence to our Code of Conduct.
>We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:
>Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia including targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called ""conversion therapy"".
>At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
>Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.
>You can read more information here
>We have a mission to make
column4: > a safe and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of their gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, mental or physical disability, political views, and personal appearance.

column2: >We are resolute in protecting the
column4: > community from harassment and malicious content from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

column2: >Our Code of Conduct is our north star. It lays out our expected standards of conduct and behaviours that all
column4: > users must follow while using this platform.

column2: >We believe that freedom of expression is not freedom of reach.
column3: > You may say whatever you want, but we reserve the right to keep you from using our platform to say it. Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome in
column5: > and neither are users that engage in name-calling, ad-hominem attacks, or other uncivil behaviour. These activities will be actioned accordingly based on our Code of Conduct.

column2: >This is a voluntary community and you choose to be here.
column3: > By joining and using this service, you give your tacit agreement to our Code of Conduct and agree to follow it, or risk losing your privilege to access this platform.
> We have a zero-tolerance policy on toxic and hateful speech. This includes attacks against anyone&rsquo
column4: s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, disability, personal appearance, or socio-economic status. Discussions related to these topics can be difficult because we don't have similar lived experiences. If you choose to discuss these topics, empathy and kindness are a must, and if you&rsquo
column5: re not able to do so, just mute and move on.

column2: >No incitement of violence and no promotion of misleading or violent ideologies.
column3: >You may not make specific threats of violence or physical harm, death, or disease to an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting misleading information that may lead to physical harm. You also may not affiliate with organisations that &mdash
column4: whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform &mdash
column5: use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.

column2: >No harassment, dogpiling, or unwanted advances.
column3: >You may not continue to engage with a user who has explicitly requested that you stop. This includes consistent baiting, bad-faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc.
>Unauthorised requests for or distribution of any personal information or data is not allowed. Please treat personally identifying information with respect and privacy.

column2: >No content illegal in Canada or copyrighted content that you don't own rights to.
column3: >Illegal or copyrighted content is not allowed to be stored, posted, or discussed on mstdn.ca&nbsp

column2: >Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked appropriately.
column3: > Posts and images with sexually explicit or violence must be flagged as sensitive and contain a content warning noting either &lsquo
column5: or &lsquo
column6: Violence&rsquo
column7: when posting. Users may not have sexually explicit or violent media as a profile photo or header image. There are also types of sensitive media content that we don&rsquo
column8: t allow at all, including violent sexual conduct, gratuitous gore, and hateful imagery. We prohibit violent sexual conduct to prevent the normalization of sexual assault and non-consensual violence associated with sexual acts. We prohibit gratuitous gore content because research has shown that repeated exposure to violent content online may negatively impact an individual&rsquo

column3: > Excessive posting, boosting, advertising or mass-marketing posts will be actioned accordingly and based on intent.

>Accounts intended to impersonate or parody are not permitted, and those found to be directly misrepresenting themselves as another person or entity will be actioned accordingly. General parody accounts like Beaverton or CBC Pitchbot are allowed as they are not impersonating a person or entity.

column2: >The list below is a collection of norms and behaviours that will help us build a community that we all want to participate in. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule (it&rsquo
>We are not an advertising platform.
column3: > If you are here only to sell your products or services, you will be removed. Occasional posts of commercial links are acceptable, but if the vast majority of a user's posts are commercial in nature, we will regard the account as a spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of spam on a case-by-case basis.

column2: >Do not report every post that upsets you.
column3: > Please report posts that violate our Code of Conduct. For other posts that you find distasteful or don&rsquo
column5: t violate the rules, use the mute, filter, or block functionality. Let the moderation team focus on the real problematic posts.

column3: > In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of:

column2: >Content warnings (CWs) are a kind way to let people choose to opt-out of potentially disturbing or controversial topics like spoilers or triggering/traumatic posts. CWs are also mandatory on posts containing gore, violence, or NSFW. If in doubt, err on the side of caution.&nbsp

>Alt-text captioning of media files can help our vision-impaired community members join in on the discussion. Alt-text is needed for those who rely upon screen readers to read what's on their screen. Without this, screen readers can't describe images to those who can't see them.
>#CamelCase use of hashtags can help screen readers read the hashtags properly.

column4: > When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

column5: s personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment.

column3: > In discussions, please remain civil, and do not insult the person you&#39
column4: re talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don&#39
column5: t translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings. Criticize ideas, not people.

column3: > You are responsible for what you boost. If you boost content that doesn&#39
column4: t comply with our rules, moderators may take action.

>The mstdn.ca team acknowledges that the areas where we work, live, and play, span across many Territories and Treaty areas and we are exceedingly grateful for the traditional Knowledge Keepers and Elders who are with us today, those who have gone before us, and the youth that inspire us.&nbsp
>We recognize the land and the benefits it provides all of us, as an act of Reconciliation, and as recommended by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission&rsquo
column3: s (TRC) 94 Calls to Action, and give gratitude to those whose territory we reside on, work on or are visiting.

column2: >We are committed to continuing to learn, evolve and grow to ensure we are aligned with Indigenous-led Reconciliation frameworks.

column2: >Follow friends and discover new ones among more than 4.5M people. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, and video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

column3: t just a website, it is a federation&mdash
column4: think Star Trek. Thousands of independent communities running Mastodon form a coherent network, where while every planet is different, being part of one is being part of the whole.

column2: >Mastodon comes with effective anti-abuse tools to help protect yourself. Thanks to the network&#39
column3: s spread out and independent nature there are more moderators who you can approach for personal help and servers with strict codes of conduct.

column2: >You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can edit the post or even delete &amp
>Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume the content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic &mdash
column3: you decide who you want to see!

column2: >Hosted by DigitalOcean in their TOR1 data centre located on Treaty 13 land at 45 Parliament Street, Toronto, ON, M5A 2Y5. Media is replicated to caching endpoints around the world.

A few rules we adhere to on this instance:

• Treat others respectfully: Refrain from any form of insult, bullying or discrimination, including but not limited to racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, anti-Semitic and misogynistic remarks or actions toward others.
• Use an appropriate tone: Use a respectful and friendly tone, even if you disagree with someone.
• Respect the privacy of others: Do not share personal information without explicit permission and respect the privacy rights of others.
• Compliance with applicable law: Do not post illegal content.
• Avoid misinformation: Do not share false or misleading information.
• No spam posts: Refrain from posting unsolicited advertisements or similar content that does not fit the community.

• Mark sensitive content (CW): Please mark any content that may contain common triggers, is sexually explicit or violent as sensitive (CW) to ensure the safety of other members. Note: Accounts that exclusively post such content may be limited or banned.
• You must be older than 16 years: According to European law, you must be at least 16 years old to use this instance.
Notwithstanding these rules, the moderation reserves the right to delete posts or block an account for any reason. This
also includes content on other websites (linked Twitter/blog).
If you see any violations of the rules or are not sure if, use the report function, or send us an email.
If you or a loved one is facing a crisis, remember that you are not alone. There are people ready to help you through this difficult time.
For a comprehensive list of helplines in different countries, addressing a range of issues, visit https://findahelpline.com/
Help us fund the servers for this instance by making a donation through the Open Collective. Your financial support is welcome, but not a requirement to use this instance.

¬°Bienvenido(a) a TKZ.One! Somos una instancia de Mastodon en Espa√±ol enfocada en el mundo Gaming, Geek y de hobbies, incluyendo, pero no limitados al anime, manga, videojuegos, c√≥mics, tecnolog√≠a, cine y series, literatura, viajes, gastronom√≠a...

Valoramos la diversidad de contenido y la de los usuarios, creando as√≠ un espacio seguro para cualquier colectivo donde poder compartir estos temas sea cual sea tu identidad de genero, sexo, raza, orientaci√≥n sexual.
Nuestra prioridad es centrarnos en mantener una comunidad unida y con buen rollo donde compartir estos temas desde el respeto y manteniendo un tono pol√≠tico bajo o nulo en medida de lo posible.
A continuaci√≥n, te presentamos nuestras normas en detalle para garantizar un ambiente positivo, agradable e inclusivo para todos los usuarios:
<li>La mayor√≠a del contenido en tu perfil debe estar relacionado con la tem√°tica de la instancia (anime, manga, gaming, tecnolog√≠a, cine, series, etc.).
<li>Si bien no censuramos otros tipos de contenidos, es importante que la esencia de tu perfil est√© alineada con nuestros intereses principales.
<li>Fomentamos un ambiente amable, cordial y de buen rollo entre todos los usuarios.
<li>No toleramos comportamientos que generen mal estar o rompan las normas b√°sicas de convivencia.
<li>Cualquier cuenta que perturbe la armon√≠a de la comunidad podr√≠a ser invitada a abandonar la instancia o ser suspendida.
<li>Esto incluye pero no se limita al racismo, sexismo, homofobia y transfobia.
<li>El uso del espa√±ol es obligatorio en esta instancia, incluyendo los dem√°s idiomas usados en Espa√±a como el catal√°n, valenciano, gallego, euskera, entre otros.
<li>Se puede escribir en otros idiomas pero la cuenta debe ir enfocada mayoritariamente a estos idiomas.
<li>Se permite el uso del lenguaje inclusivo a gusto de cada uno.
<li>Est√° prohibida la publicaci√≥n de pornograf√≠a infantil, lolicon, as√≠ como cualquier contenido que incite a la violencia o promueva ideolog√≠as violentas.
<li>No se permite contenido ilegal bajo las leyes espa√±olas en nuestra instancia ni promover dicho contenido.
<li>Cada usuario es responsable de sus comentarios y publicaciones. Este servidor de Mastodon no se hace responsable de las opiniones individuales de los usuarios.
<li>No permitimos cuentas centradas en el activismo reivindicativo ni en la pol√≠tica institucional.

<li>Aunque est√° permitido abordar temas pol√≠ticos, sociales y econ√≥micos, es importante que la cuenta no tenga una finalidad propagand√≠stica ni haya sido creada con fines de activismo reivindicativo, social o pol√≠tico. Adem√°s, los temas tratados deben relacionarse con la tem√°tica principal de la instancia y ser abordados dentro del contexto apropiado.
<li>Las cuentas que promuevan el nazismo, intolerancia racial, antisemitismo, racismo o supremacia est√°n estrictamente prohibidas.

<li>Queda terminantemente prohibido cualquier comportamiento que atente contra la dignidad de las personas debido a su raza, sexo, orientaci√≥n sexual, identidad de g√©nero, situaci√≥n personal o riesgo de exclusi√≥n social.

<li>Las faltas de respetos, insultos reiterados, o cualquier otro comportamiento que atente contra el bienestar de la comunidad est√° prohibido y es amonestable. En caso de reiteraci√≥n se puede suspender al usuario.
<li>Evita compartir informaci√≥n falsa de manera intencionada. No contribuyas a la difusi√≥n de bulos.
<li>Si has compartido algo y se ha verificado ser un bulo, por favor, ret√≠ralo lo antes posible.
<li>El uso de IA para generar contenido est√° permitido dentro un contexto y uso razonable siempre y cuando la cuenta no se dedique a promocionar su contenido.
<li>Las cuentas centradas en promover contenido generado por IA, tanto en el servidor como fuera de √©l mediante sitios de terceros, est√°n prohibidas.
<li>Bajo el criteri del equipo de moderaci√≥n se podr√° advertir o cancelar cuentas que incumplan esta norma.

<li>El contenido para adultos, como desnudos exceptuando pornograf√≠a expl√≠cita, violencia y gore, solo se permite en forma de creaciones art√≠sticas de autor√≠a propia (FanArts, ilustraciones, dibujos, etc.), siempre que se relacionen con nuestra tem√°tica y se utilice la etiqueta CW.
<li>El equipo de moderaci√≥n tendr√° siempre la √∫ltima palabra para valorar este contenido.
<li>No permitimos cuentas que solo utilicen el crossposting entre redes sociales sin interactuar con la comunidad.
<li>Nos reservamos el derecho de suspender cuentas que consideremos que abusan de esta pr√°ctica.

<li>Las cuentas de SPAM, phishing y las centradas en la promoci√≥n de criptoactivos de dudoso origen o actividades econ√≥micas que puedan ser perjudiciales para los miembros de la comunidad est√°n estrictamente prohibidas.
Es obligatorio leer y aceptar estas normas al registrarte en nuestra instancia.
Recuerda que si tienes alguna duda o piensas que hay algo incorrecto o que pueda llevar a errores, puedes contactar directamente con nosotros. La comunidad la hacemos entre todos.
¬°Esperamos que disfrutes de tu estancia en TKZ.One y contribuyas a crear un espacio seguro para todos los frikis doonde compartir nuestros temas favoritos!

Welcome to toot.community - your gateway to the wider Fediverse! We'
column2: re a generic Mastodon instance proudly hosted in The Netherlands, committed to providing an open, ad-free, and respectful environment for all our users.

column1: Our instance serves as a platform for dialogue, connection, and shared learning, embodying the values of inclusivity and respect. We strive to maintain a welcoming atmosphere for people from all walks of life, irrespective of their race, ethnicity, gender, religion, or nationality.

column2: re stepping into a world where voices from across the globe intermingle. It&#39
column3: s more than just a Mastodon instance‚Äîit&#39
column4: s a portal to the greater Fediverse, a universe teeming with diverse thoughts, cultures, and ideas.

column1: Here at toot.community, we value your privacy and peace of mind over everything else. That'
column2: s why we promise not to display advertisements or sell your data. Instead, we operate on the goodwill and generous contributions of our members.

column1: Maintaining and operating a server comes with its share of expenses. Currently, these costs are entirely borne by user donations and @ruud. If you enjoy our services and have an account with us, we kindly ask you to consider supporting us financially.

Every bit helps us maintain our independence and ensures that we can continue to provide a secure, ad-free platform for everyone hosted on this instance. It provides a measure of financial security and helps us keep this wonderful community thriving.
There are two ways you can donate:

• Support via Ko-Fi - Accepts payments through Credit Card, PayPal, Apple Pay, and Google Pay. As a token of our gratitude, everyone who donates through Ko-Fi receives a special shoutout on our @funding account.
• Support via Patreon - Accepts payments through Credit Card. Regular contributions via Patreon help us plan for the future with confidence.

We intend to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This document contains the rules and principles for participating in our platform. This is a working document, so our team may amend it from time to time.

• Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristics.
<li>Create a supportive community where people freely share their passions and are excited and optimistic about each other&#39

• Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content, and individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

• We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything violating these rules or principles and remain a community member. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.

• The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want if what you post follows these rules, principles, and the goals outlined above. Not every community member will appreciate controversial or explicit posts, so use Content Warnings liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit.
• Bullies, trolls, and disruptors are not welcome in our community. We will moderate accordingly.
• This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you decide to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.
The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.
General guidance on posting and participating in this community

• Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about provocative topics at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases. Still, posting inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning is never good.
• Do not post any nudity without a Content Warning.

• Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. You will be removed if you are here only to sell your products or services. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when most of a user'
column2: s posts are commercial, we regard the account as Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case-by-case basis.

column1: • Do not engage in name-calling, ad hominem attacks, or other uncivil behavior. Criticize ideas, never people.
• Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful or don'
column2: t like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

column1: Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it'
column2: s more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from this community when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one violation can result in suspending the user account.

column1: The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isn'
column2: t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for this community, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the moderation team&#39
column3: s discretion, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

column1: Your questions, feedback, and concerns are always welcome. For any instance-related queries or support needs, please reach out to our dedicated @support account.
Alternatively, you can write to us via:
Thank you for being part of our community! We&#39
column2: re here to help and look forward to hearing from you.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to punitive action and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.
You can find our real time service status on the ATLAS Media Group Status Page.

Universeodon.com is a space for all humans who have a little curiosity. The kind of person who enjoys edutainment, reads books, watches science shows and loves to connect with people who view the universe through wonder. There are no forced topics here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, physicists, and connect with people who share similar interests &
From exploring the universe, to exploring the world we all share - everyone is welcome here.

Whether you love music, movies, TV, sports, books or knitting or anything in between - We all live in this wonderful universe, and I hope to see you exploring your hobbies, passions, and interests with amazing people across the #FEDIVERSE - The Universe

Urbanists.Social is a Mastodon instance for urbanists - people who are into bikes, transit, and / or walkable cities.
Want to donate to us? Check out our Open Collective here!

We generally align ourself with the policies and goals of other instances like mastodon.social, awoo.space, and icosahedron.website. We want our server to be a safe space for our users. Generally the rules boil down to ""don't be a dick"", but a few worth drawing attention to:
• Any content that is illegal under US or EU law is prohibited. We're run by a small community, please don't get us in trouble.

• No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, and any other discriminatory conduct that attacks any individual or group of individuals based on what they are or what they believe is strictly forbidden. This excludes shitting on drivers, but still try to be nice.
• Any conduct that abuses this Mastodon instance, or any other Mastodon instance, is strictly forbidden.
• Your user profile (including your name and display name) must be SWF. NSFW content is not banned, but please be sure to tag it appropriately.
• Please be considerate and respectful of others. Consider adding content warnings to your posts about controversial subjects or commonly-held phobias.
• No harassment. Harassment is any improper or unwelcome conduct that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation to another person.
Our admins on this server are @sam and @zak.

This is not Twitter. Reporting posts that make you feel uncomfortable, or that you feel should be brought to our attention, is highly encouraged. Your reports will not be ignored, and will be dealt with (usually) within a few days. It may take more than a week due to timezone differences or jobs, but you will always hear back about your report, and it won't be closed until you're happy with the resolution for the report. If your report involves a user or post on another instance, you have the choice of sharing your report with the administration of that instance as well, but the report will always be sent to us. Please include in the report whether you chose to send the report to the other instance, though.
No moderation actions are automatic whatsoever. Nothing happens without human review.
We follow the Mastodon server covenant. If we decide to close the server, we will give you minimum three months notice. Our hosting provider, masto.host, does daily backups of our database.

Defederation occurs when we limit access to other Mastodon instances. We do this through domain blocks, where we silence or suspend other servers by their domain name. Silencing an instance will make all posts from all accounts on the instance invisible to anyone who isn't following them on our server. Suspending will remove all of the instance‚Äôs content and media, and will not allow you to follow any users there.

We use domain blocks to keep our server safe, to pressure other instances to moderate more effectively, and to decrease the amount of moderation of remote content we have to do. We monitor the [#Fediblock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) for reports from users and admins for troublesome accounts and instances.
We don‚Äôt yet have a specific set of rules we follow when blocking instances, but generally this is our policy:
• Any instance whose purpose, stated goals, or moderation rules conflict with any of our rules are immediately suspended. Fairly self-explanatory. We don‚Äôt want this content on our server.
• Example: We do not allow promotion of crypto. Cryptodon clearly breaks this rule and it has been suspended.
• Another example: There are multiple instances for TERFs. We do not allow TERFs or ‚Äògender critical‚Äô bullshit on our server, so multiple TERF sites have been suspended.
• Instances that do not have adequate prohibition of hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.

• A large percentage of these instances are ‚Äòfree speech‚Äô servers with little to no rules. Remaining federated with these instances opens our users to a high possibility of receiving abuse from them.
• Example: Gab does not have adequate rules against hate speech. It‚Äôs an alt-right hellhole known for harassing lots of minorities in the Fediverse. So it has been suspended.
• Instances with admins that engage in hate speech or harassment are immediately suspended.
• Admins that do this are not capable of moderating hate speech or harassment, point blank. We do not want our users to be subject to their users‚Äô harassment or hate speech.

• Example: Alex Gleason is a well-known TERF who regularly posts hate speech and harassment on his servers. This behavior attracts more TERFs to his servers who engage in the same behavior. As a result, all instances Gleason runs are suspended on our server.
• Instances that are on lots of our peers‚Äô block lists are very likely to be suspended.

• We trust the admin work of our peer instances, especially those that are larger than our own server. As a server that hasn‚Äôt received a lot of abuse, we like to prevent it before it happens. Watching other instances‚Äô block lists is key to making this happen.
• Instances reported on #FediBlock are very likely to be silenced or suspended.

• If we get repeat reports about an instance on the [#FediBlock](https://urbanists.social/tags/FediBlock) hashtag, we are very likely to take action against that instance. A high frequency of these reports from multiple users usually indicates a good candidate for a domain block.

• Example: The admin of journa.host has been the subject of numerous complaints on the FediBlock tag. As a result of this, they have been silenced. This prevents our users from receiving random harassment from their users, while also allowing our users to follow users on the server.
• Instances with questionable moderation are highly likely to be silenced or suspended.

• Example: c.im bans exactly one server. They‚Äôve received numerous complaints on #FediBlock due to their admin not moderating content effectively. As a result of this, we‚Äôve silenced their server.

Users have requested the following instances to be unblocked, and the admins have reviewed them and put them on a probation list. We'll take any reports against these instances seriously and we'll be more likely to block them again.

Please read the server rules and the information below before signing up to and/or using Zirkus. If you don‚Äôt agree to all of the terms set out here, please do not use this server. By continuing to use Zirkus, you agree to be bound by the terms set out here.
• Language: There are no language rules on this server. English is de facto the main language, but feel free (even encouraged!) to post in other languages.

• Content warnings: We do not require a content warning (CW) for posts about politics, social justice, etc. However, we ask that you be kind and considerate: include CWs if you believe your post may be distressing.
• Bots: Bots are allowed. Try to make them fun.
• Cross-posting: Cross-posting from Twitter, RSS, etc. is fine (and even encouraged if it helps you become more active here).

column3: . The point of this arts/humanities community is to gather like-minded people who will make posts that are interesting to each other. But that doesn&#39
column4: t mean that everything has to be about books, art, etc. This is a community to connect people, not enforce specific topics of discussion.

column1: • Self-promotion: There are many writers and artists on this server, and we are more than happy for you to promote your work from your personal account. We request, however, that you do so in a tasteful and not spammy manner.

• Industry promotion: If you are a commercial entity of interest to our community (literary magazine, publishing house, etc.), we are also happy for you to promote here in a tasteful manner. However, we request that you make a modest donation, as this is a volunteer-run server that relies on crowdfunding (see below). Please contact the admins if you have any questions.
• You can donate to Zirkus on Patreon here.
• We are run entirely by volunteers on a non-profit basis and are dependent on donations to cover our hosting costs.

column2: re currently hosted on masto.host and are looking to raise $420/month to support 5,500 users comfortably. We will publish new goals as necessary based on our user numbers.

column1: • We ultimately hope to crowdfund via Open Collective, which offers greater transparency over expenses and more flexibility for contributors. Our Patreon page is a temporary solution while we await approval from a fiscal host on Open Collective. Once we have migrated crowdfunding to Open Collective, all funds raised on Patreon will be transferred to that account, the Patreon page will be shut down and contributors will be informed of the move.
• Every little helps a lot. We‚Äôd like to thank our community for all their support so far!
• When you report an account or server, please indicate which server rule has been broken and include any extra context or explanation, if possible.
• We are volunteer moderators and will try to address the issue as soon as we are able.
• You will not be notified about the result, even if it has led to punitive action, which may not be visible to the outside. The response will be proportional to the nature of the offence.
• Please bear in mind that your posts ‚Äì depending on their visibility ‚Äì are public. We recommend not sharing information publicly that you do not intend to share with the whole internet.

• When you post, bear in mind that posts cannot be hidden by locking an account. Posts can be deleted either manually or set to auto-delete within various timeframes. Please familiarize yourself with the different visibility options for posting: Public, Unlisted, Followers Only, and Mentioned People Only (i.e. a direct message).
• The displaying and distribution of your post happens strictly according to the visibility rules you have set for the post. We will not modify the visibility of the post you have set.
• We can see basic account and profile information that you provide when signing up to the server, such as username, email, name (real or fake) and IP address.
• We do not share your information with any third parties.

• The server administrators can technically access users‚Äô direct messages, but pledge not to do so. This option is also not available in the default admin UI. We strongly recommend not sending any confidential or private information via direct message on Mastodon (or equally on Twitter) because the messages are not end-to-end encrypted. WhatsApp and Signal are currently end-to-end encrypted applications.

• We do not log information about your use of this server or run any form of analytics. Our hosting provider, masto.host, keeps a log of the IP addresses of the requests made to the server, which is auto-deleted in less than 90 days.

• You are responsible for the content that you make available to the server, including its legality and appropriateness. Please abide by the above server rules when using Zirkus. In case of breach of rules, the administrators reserve the right to remove you.

• In no event will Zirkus, the administrators and the moderators be liable to you or any third party for any special, indirect, incidental, exemplary or consequential damages of any kind arising out of or in connection with the server and content included on or otherwise made available to you through the server.

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.
• You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
• Read more on post and account visibility here
What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon
If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you‚Äôre not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.
• United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
• Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

column1: • Company, company-like, and/or business accounts, currently known as corporate accounts, are invite-only. Unofficial corporate accounts will be suspended.

• Those looking to create accounts for non-profit entities should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
• Bot accounts are allowed with restrictions (please see our Bot Account documentation).
• Qualifying Open Source Project accounts are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
• Qualifying Community Events are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
• Essentially: anyone interested in creating an account that is not a general user should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
• Large / Influencer account set ups and transfers, which is defined as more than 10k on any platform, need to reach out to the Admin team prior to transfer at admin@hachyderm.io.
For more information about all of the above, please see our Account Types documentation.

Hi! This is a general-purpose Mastodon server. It does not have any particular topic or target audience. Everyone is welcome to sign up as long as they are willing to follow our rules set out below.
In addition to the information provided below, we also have a blog and about page at about.ohai.social.
The best way to get in touch for questions and issues concerning the server is through support@ohai.social.
We accept donations toward the operation of the server through Patreon.
There are currently three moderators for ohai.social:
You can check the current server status on our monitoring page at status.ohai.is.

This Mastodon server is hosted on bare metal in a data center in the south of Germany. Two people have access to the infrastructure, and all SSH access is exclusively using hardware security tokens. We will never sell or otherwise use your data for anything other than the operation of this Mastodon server, and we certainly do not read your DMs.
All database data is backed up twice daily in a physically different location from the live data (Specifically, at BorgBase).
In the unlikely event that we will ever have to shut down the server, we intend to give at least 6+ months of notice ahead of the shutdown.

The list below is a collection of behavior that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

• In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
• When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

column2: s personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.

column1: • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
• If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
• Bots may only interact with a user when they'
column2: re invited by that user to do so.

column1: • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "
column3: and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions (&quot
column5: ). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.

column1: • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you'
column2: re talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don&#39
column3: t translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

The Union Place is hosted on Google Cloud infrastructure. It is a personal project and is not sponsored, approved, or affiliated with Google in any way.

column1: We aim to review new account requests every 2-4 hours throughout the day, but are likely to do less review during the United States overnight.

The Union Place has a zero-tolerance policy for racism, antisemitism, Islamophobia, xenophobia, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and other forms of discriminatory and bigoted conduct.
Sexually graphic and violent imagery is not permitted on The Union Place.
Harassment of other Fediverse users is not permitted on The Union Place.
Harmful content that is provably false (for example, ‚Äú5G causes coronavirus‚Äù or ‚Äúvaccines cause autism‚Äù) is not allowed, will be removed, and may result in an account suspension.
Far-right content and expression of far-right ideologies, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites far-right extremism are an instant ban.
We reserve the right to suspend your account at any time.
We may update this document from time to time for reasons including:
In the event of any changes to this policy, we will notify you via an announcement posted via the Mastodon administration system.
Any changes to the Code of Conduct come into effect immediately.

Final interpretation of the following guidelines is up to the administration of The Union Place and is at our sole discretion. They are posted here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies and procedures.
The Union Place is open to all union members, organizations, friends, and allies. Content posted on The Union Place need not be entirely, or even majority, union or labor-movement related.

Given the broad consensus among many marginalized and progressive communities that police unions are not a true part of the labor movement, police unions are not welcome on The Union Place. We will not specifically screen to prevent members of police unions from joining, but content pushing a pro-police and pro-police union agenda will be considered unacceptable. Police union locals and other directly-related advocacy groups are not eligible to maintain an account on The Union Place.
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may be removed entirely:
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources.
The following types of content will be removed, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
<li>Pornography and sexually explicit or graphic content, including artistic depictions,
• We welcome labor organizing among sex workers,
<li>Any gore and/or extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions,
• We welcome documentation of current events, such as clashes that break out at protests, but require use of content warnings on both content and images,
<li>Content harmful to the public good, examples including:
• ‚ÄúVaccines cause autism‚Äù (or, for clarity, any other anti-science and anti-vaccine content)
<li>Content that is illegal in the United States and the Commonwealth of Virginia, or material encouraging, instructing, or soliciting others to break the law.

• This point shall not be applied with regards to matters regarding civil rights movements, civil disobedience and labor actions, access to reproductive rights and education, LGBTQIA+ rights and education, regardless of contested status under the law.
• We welcome discussions which remain academic, regarding past lived personal experience, or theoretical in nature, but require use of content warnings.
• We acknowledge that there are several murky legal grey areas, and would like to remind users that Content posted on the Internet, and by extension the Instance, is never truly private.
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed, and will result in permanent revocation of access to the service:
<li>Content discriminating against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof, including transphobic content,
*‚ÄâAbleism and discrimination against disabled individuals or people with disabilities,
• Inappropriate content (advocating, encouraging, or inciting pedophilia, zoophilia, or other related illegal paraphilias, any material relating therein),
• Antisemitism, Islamophobia, and xenophobia, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites such,
• Far-right content and expression of far-right ideologies, and/or content which advocates/encourages/incites far-right extremism,
<li>Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism,
• Academic discussion criticising viewpoints such as Holocaust denialism may be had, but require use of content warnings,
• Photographs from events and news coverage which include imagery which would be illegal in Germany and/or France may be posted marked sensitive and require use of content warnings,
<li>Our servers are hosted in the United States
column2: other content under that law will be addressed on a case-by-case basis at the discretion of the administration team with consideration for any municipalities that are directly involved, as well as whether it complies with the rest of the Code of Conduct and Terms of Service,

column1: • Genocide denialism, as well as material which promotes, advocates for, or encourages genocides whether past or present, and
• Conduct promoting, advocating for, or encouraging any far-right ideology.

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service and/or referral to the appropriate law enforcement agency, at our discretion.
• Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion,
• Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment,
• Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names,
• Simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ‚Äúhug‚Äù or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop,
• Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to engage in self-harm or to commit suicide,
• Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes,
• Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others,
• Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease,
• Deliberate ‚Äúouting‚Äù of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent,

• Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed,

column2: s demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (doxing or dropping dox),

column1: • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (brigading or dogpiling).
The Union Place prioritizes the safety of marginalized people over the comfort of privileged people. As a result, we will not act on complaints regarding, but not limited to:
• Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äòleave me alone‚Äô, ‚Äògo away‚Äô, or ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not discussing this with you‚Äô,
• Communicating in a ‚Äòtone‚Äô you don‚Äôt find congenial, and
• Criticizing racist, sexist, cis-sexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions.
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.
If you are being harassed by a user of The Union Place, notice that someone else is being harassed, please report using the ‚ÄòReport‚Äô feature in the application.
This Code of Conduct applies to The Union Place, but if you are being harassed by a user of The Union Place outside of the Service, we still want to know about it.

We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by The Union Place members seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The administration team of The Union Place reserve the right to exclude people from The Union Place based on their past behavior, including behavior outside The Union Place spaces and behavior towards people who are not users of The Union Place.
Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.
For reporting regarding copyright and DMCA violation, please see our DMCA‚ÄâPolicy.
These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user'
column2: s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Membership at TWiT.social is free and open to all TWiT listeners, but if you would like to financially support us please consider joining Club TWiT. https://twit.tv/club There are lots of other benefits for your $7/month, including an active Discord server.

NOTE: Due to the unprecedented growth of the Fediverse in the past weeks we are limiting this server to TWiT LISTENERS ONLY! For a list of other servers you can join visit https://mastodon.help/instances Thanks!
