If you find content that is in violation of the Server Rules, please report the account. You may also take action from your own account by muting or blocking the account, or the entire domain/instance.

We actively ""defederate"" masto.nu from other instances that are incompatible with our fundamental rules, in an effort to protect our users. This comes from reports of users but also community discussion around such bad actors. If you find another instance that you think needs to be restricted from interacting with ours, or if you feel that another instance may have been blocked by our staff in error, please reach out to our staff directly via DM.

masto.nu is working on getting listed on joinmastodon.org and we are working to implement all Mastodon Server Covenant fundamental expectations for instance administration. This includes things like active moderation, daily backups, multiple staff members, and a commitment to provide notice to changes in the status of this instance.

There are certain ""norms"" of Mastodon, and the wider ""Fediverse"" that you'll be expected to follow while a member of this instance. This includes the use of content warnings when necessary, and the regular use of descriptive text for image uploads. Some of these norms may be different than what you're used to on other platforms. While failure to use these these are not strictly moderation worth events, we do ask that you respect and try and conform to these norms as you explore and grow on the platform.

We want to foster an open discussion where everyone feels welcome. The rules are meant to be clear and direct, but the staff of this instance has ultimate discretion on how they are enforced. We may alter to these rules as needed, but will make an effort to notify you of any major change.
If you are found to be in violation, the staff may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion from the server.

You may your close account or move it to another instance at any time. You are in control of your identity and your social graph on Mastodon (and other federated instances) but the administrators here control your ability to use this instance and ultimately to interact with its users.

In addition to regular backups we make of our infrastructure, you can backup your data and export it at any time. You can also delete your account and your data at anytime. You can even schedule regular deletions of previous posts, if that's your thing.

Unless it's required of us to investigate a reported instance of abuse of our policies, under standard operation we have no ability to regularly access your direct messages with other members of our platform. While this data is accessible with a request to our hosting providers database systems, we expect that to not be necessary except under extreme circumstances. Where possible we will notify you if such processes are taken for data associated by your account.
However, due in part to the open and federated nature of Mastodon instances, the Mastodon administrators of other instances you interact with may have access to your data.

While the connection to this site is encrypted, this is only the data in transit to you and to other servers in the federated network. The messages and data stored in the instance is not encrypted. This includes direct messages sent to other users of masto.nu! This is not a choice of the administrator, but a limitation of the Mastodon platform. Additionally, our hosting provider may have access to your data as part of the general administration of the server infrastructure.
You should use Signal, Matrix, or another E2E messaging app for the things you really want to be private.
Please review our full Privacy Policy for more information.

One of the key features of Mastodon is there's no sophisticated algorithm to drive more traffic to the site, or influence your thinking. Mastodon does offer hashtag, post, and link trending features that are based solely on observed activity within masto.nu and other federated instances.

Hashtags largely trend on their own without moderator intervention, but can be removed if they are abusive or disruptive. Some links will trend automatically if they're from mainstream or other sources known to be reputable. Some posts will trend automatically if they're from known figures with a history of appropriate content. Other trends are manually approved by our staff, and only removed if they are deemed inappropriate.
It is not required to pay for continued access to your account, but if you feel obliged to help cover the cost of running masto.nu, please visit one of our sponsor pages to help keep us going.

63714c9f80bb3f03b435a581,newsie.social,False,20806,"

Newsie is a general-purpose Mastodon server supporting all languages. With a large user base of journalists and news outlets, posts trend heavily on news and current events.
Newsie is closed to new account registrations.
Newsie subscribes and adheres to the Mastodon Server Covenant.
There is no advertising, no subscription fees, and no paywalls, and your data is never shared or sold.
We kindly request our members to contribute financially towards our significant operating costs, which include hosting, maintenance, and associated projects.
You may contribute using Open Collective or by PayPal.
One-time or monthly (preferred) $1, $5, $20, $50 or whatever feels right to you.
We have a balanced moderation policy that encourages a free press and responsible free expression and speech while enforcing rules against extremist, prohibited, and/or illegal content.
Our aim is to maintain responsible free expression while ensuring a safe and inclusive community for all users. Our moderation approach focuses on behavior that occurs on the Newsie platform.
You can report violations directly from an individual post, image, or profile, including spam, abusive or harmful content, inappropriate ads, self-harm, and impersonation.

When making a report, please make sure to include at least a few posts that demonstrate rule-breaking behavior. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please include it in the comment as well.
We usually handle most reports within 72 hours.
Please note that we do not comment on moderation actions, and you will not be notified when a report you have made has led to moderation or other action.
Additionally, not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first-time offenses, we may choose to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures for repeat offenses.
Appeals and feedback channels are available for members.
Be sure to check the Terms of Service and privacy policy.

6373799980bb3f03b435a5f1,social.vivaldi.net,False,49782,"

Vivaldi Social is part of the Mastodon network and is hosted in Iceland by the makers of Vivaldi Browser. Everyone is welcome to join.
Vivaldi provides alternatives to Big Tech. We provide a feature rich and flexible browser, mail client, calendar and feed reader in one. We also provide free and ad-free blogs and forums.
If you already are a member of the Vivaldi community and have a Vivaldi Account, you can use your credentials to log in to this instance.

We love the idea of a distributed social network based on open standards with no clear owner and no tracking or profiling of users and no algorithms that provide personalized content. So we want to help it thrive by making it easier for people to join.
This server is fully funded by Vivaldi Technologies, an employee-owned company.
By joining and posting on Vivaldi Social you agree not to post content or material that is obscene, defamatory, vulgar, sexually oriented, hateful, harassing or threatening.
For full details, please see our Terms of Use and Code of Conduct.
To report harassment, click the three vertical dots (‚ãÆ) on a user'
column4: For urgent concerns, you may contact us at vivaldisocial@vivaldi.net.

Techhub.social is a mastodon instance for passionate technologists.
All that information can be found in our Hub page.
Current infrastructure status can be found at https://status.techhub.social.
Please report the user using the ""‚Ä¶"" button and then ""Report"". Include posts in the report it makes the moderator job easier.
If it's not breaking the server rules or SPAM, please DO NOT report the content. If it's something that you don't like, in the ""‚Ä¶"" button you can also Mute or Block someone.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of techhub.social
column2: they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

column1: The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
• Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
• Untagged nudity, sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
• Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
• Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
• Content illegal in the United States of America

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:

• Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
• Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.

• Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
If you have questions, a copyright removal request or anything else please get in touch with @nicdex or send an email to hello [ at ] techhub [ dot ] social.

Mastodon instance for the biological Ecology and Evolution community.
This is broadly defined so everyone connected to those topics closely or more remotely are welcome.
Server is run by Alexis Simon through the service masto.host and hosted by OVH in France. Their terms of service can be found here.
Please, go through the Rules, Privacy Policy, Etiquette, and Documentation of the server before signing-up.
You will also be able to find general tips for using Mastodon.
This documentation can be found in the subdomain docs.ecoevo.social
If you are looking to migrate your account from another server,
You will be able to contribute financially for the maintenance of the server through Open Collective opencollective.com/ecoevosocial.
The server has switched to an approval-based sign-up system to try avoiding spamming and trolling accounts as we grow. But sign-ups are still open to anyone interested, please read on.

This server is dedicated to anyone with an interest in the subjects of ecology and evolution, both professionally and personally. We welcome students, industry scientists, folks working in other fields that have links to E&
column2: E, scientific societies, and nature enthusiasts in general. If you want to join us you almost certainly belong, so please apply!

637b2ef1d94dca7f11e7b1e9,theblower.au,False,15344,"

Follow @geton@theblower.au for server news, status updates, planned downtimes, etc. DM is currently the preferred method of communication with the staff.

column2: re able and willing to support us financially, all the ways you can do so are here: chinwag.au/theblower

column1: You must be aged 13 years or older to register for an account. We do not require you to use any particular language whilst using the service.

The Blower is a community, not a billboard or a bullhorn. As such, we do not allow brands to register accounts. Brands are invited to join another instance or create their own ‚Äì try brands.town. Use these guidelines for what we consider a Brand:
• If you are a for-profit business, you are a brand
• If you are a political party, you are a brand
If you are unsure whether you are a brand, please email admin@theblower.au to sort it out before registering.
Bot accounts (i.e., those with automated posting) are permitted on The Blower under these additional conditions:

column5: , or &quot
column6: direct&quot

column1: • The ‚ÄúThis is a bot account‚Äù checkbox must be set in the profile.
• The account must identify the bot owner in the bio.
• Bots must not interact with (mention) other accounts unless those accounts have interacted with the bot first.
We reserve the right to refuse or revoke any user'
column2: s access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

column1: The following types of content will be removed, and will result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Registering accounts with inherently malicious intent.
• Unauthorised distribution of any personal information or data (DOXing).

• Impersonation: You may not impersonate individuals, groups, or organisations in a manner that is intended to or does mislead, confuse, or deceive others. While you may maintain parody, fan, commentary accounts, you may not do so if the intent of the account is to engage in spamming or abusive behaviour. (Parody accounts must be labelled as such in the bio).
<li>Nude or pornographic images, or other content that would be considered &quot
column5: by a reasonable person under Australian law

column1: • Any conduct intended to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed.
• Queerphobia, or advocacy of queerphobia (comparisons to paedophilia, animals, dehumanising language)
• Anti-sex worker perspectives or advocation against sex workers.
• Discrimination or advocation against genders and sexual minorities.
• Ableism, fatphobia or discrimination against disabled people.
• Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
• Promotion or encouragement of suicide or self-harm.

column2: including advocating any physical, sexual, or emotional harm against individuals or groups.

column1: • Harassment of any kind, including consistent baiting, bad faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc. especially towards marginalised groups.
• Promotion of scams, including web3/crypto and other ponzi schemes.
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
• Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism (Seriously. Absolutely no Nazis!).
• Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism, or similar content illegal in the state of Victoria, Germany, Switzerland and/or France.

• Violence: You may not make specific threats of violence or wish for the serious physical harm, death, or disease of an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting terrorism. You also may not affiliate with organisations that ‚Äî whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform ‚Äî use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
• Child exploitation: You may not post (or promote) suggestive depictions of children in any way (regardless of context). Example: No bath photos

We encourage the use of Content Warnings (aka Content Wrappers, aka Summaries, aka Topics, aka Subject lines, hereafter CWs) on your posts. CWs are a courtesy to your readers and other members of The Blower community. CWs are not self-censorship: they do not suppress the indexing of posts, only their initial visibility.
The Blower believes that CWs are an important tool to support people'
column2: s self-autonomy, but they can also be used for expression and creativity.

column1: CWs are not expected on posts made by marginalised people about their own marginalisation, though authors may choose to do so.

We strive to be a welcoming, and safe instance. Mastodon has safety features such as word/hashtag filtering to limit visibility to unwanted content, and we encourage the use of block/muting other accounts rather than engaging in vitriolic arguments. Please make use of the ability to report accounts that break the rules.

Please report users who break following the code of conduct, but please do not message people on behalf of the moderation team. Instead, you can scroll on, block, mute, or report to let moderators deal with it.
• Criticising racist, sexist, or otherwise oppressive behaviour or assumptions.
• Good faith and non-malicious conduct whose object is to ameliorate (improve) the conditions of disadvantaged individuals or groups.
• Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äúleave me alone,‚Äù ‚Äúgo away,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not discussing this with you‚Äù.

The Blower is one of many Fediverse communities, each with their own rules, moderation, and ethos. You are able to move servers in the future without losing your followers if this instance turns out to not be the best place for you.
Red Telephone by Julieta Lach Julie from Pixabay
,Do you need to sort it out? Get on The Blower, a public social network site that's part of a global federation! Give it a go!

You don't have to be Australian to post here, but it helps.",The Blower,,,True,"[{'id': '9', 'text': 'Bot accounts must comply with the eligibility rules'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'Brands are not allowed'}, {'id': '11', 'text': 'All users must comply with the Code of Conduct'}, {'id': '12', 'text': 'No harassment or bullying allowed'}, {'id': '13', 'text': 'No adult 18+ images allowed'}, {'id': '14', 'text': 'No sexualised or suggestive images of children allowed'}]","['Bot accounts must comply with the eligibility rules', 'Brands are not allowed', 'All users must comply with the Code of Conduct', 'No harassment or bullying allowed', 'No adult 18+ images allowed', 'No sexualised or suggestive images of children allowed']"

637b2fc1d94dca7f11e7b55a,mstdn.science,False,7094,"

This instance represents a community of scientists and people in related fields, and we are in a very collaborative environment. As such, we would like to treat each other with respect. We expect the same level of professionalism expected at any scientific meeting.
If you want to contribute to running costs, you can do so via Open Collective.

Open Collective allows bank transfer and credit/debit card payments via Stripe. This is our preferred option for contributions. You can donate anonymously if you wish. You can also transparently see how we are spending the money kindly given by our community to finance our expenses. Visit https://opencollective.com/mstdnscience.
Every little bit really can help! If 10% of the users on mstdn.science give at least ¬£7 a year, we can cover all of our basic costs!
If you must use paypal, you can do so via liberapay.
Our full terms of service and privacy policy can be found here

,http://mstdn.science is a place for people our field (microbiology), scientists in general, and science enthusiasts to discuss research and topics surrounding our work.",mstdn.science,,,True,Unknown error,['Rule is not a list']
• It's hosted in the EU and running on renewable energy
• If you want to stay longer than a month you need to get a membership
20 % of the membership fees goes towards planting trees. You can see how many we've planted in the tree counter. More details can be found in our tree reports.
Mastodon.green is part of the GreenFedi community. You can find our blog, FAQ and help pages on the community website.
You can post almost anything you want, but not everything. We expect you to abide by the community guidelines.
• Our guidelines apply to all content, including content arriving from remote servers.

FediScience is a social network for publishing scientists. Everyone is welcome to join from PhD student to professor, as well as researchers from outside of academia. You are welcome to stay afterwards, but it is also easy to change to another server.
There will be a lot of science talk on this server, but there is no need to only talk science.
This site is owned and operated by the charitable association FediScience e.V. and other volunteers from the FediScience community.
FediScience e.V. is registered in Munich, Germany</br>

FediScience is a community for active scientists. Establishing the exact definition of ""science"" and who is actively contributing to it is a long-standing open problem (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demarcation_problem).

Therefore, we need to fix a criterium. We have opted to assume that researchers currently publishing in scientific journals are active scientists, knowing the potential limitations of this definition. To register on FediScience, you'll need to provide us with evidence that you are working as a publishing scientist or aspiring to be one, by sending us a link to your ORCID, academic web page, or similar where we can see your contributions. We will not save or use this information for anything other than the verification process. For students or junior researchers who have not yet published a paper - no problem! Just explain your situation. It will help us if you can add a link where we can see that you are affiliated with a research institution.
Other edge cases will be moderated on an individual basis. If you really think that you are a good match for the FediScience community, please apply and carefully explain your situation.
As many people as possible should feel welcome at FediScience, so please follow the code of conduct.
• You do not have to give your name, but please tell us about your expertise and interests in your bio and introduce yourself using the #introductions hashtag.
• Don‚Äôt do anything that‚Äôs illegal in Germany or where you live.

column2: do not engage in exclusionary behaviour or language. Consider not only the current interaction, but how it would be if your behaviour were common.

column1: • Don‚Äôt harass people. Respect it if people want to stop an interaction. Sexual attention can constitute harassment, even if it wasn‚Äôt intended to cause upset.
• Please relax. Don‚Äôt assume you know better than the person you‚Äôre talking to.
Users violating these rules may have their accounts suspended and will not be welcome to take part any more.
If you are subject to or observe any harassment, or have any other concerns, please report the toot concerned or message a moderator. Reports will be dealt with discreetly and in confidence.
We want everyone to have a great time and treat each other with respect.

Mastodon has Content Warnings, please use them. They can be used to collapse a long (series) of messages, but also to hide topics some may find upsetting, especially when people would not expect this kind of content in your stream, e.g., when you are not talking about your area of expertise.
At the bottom of the message editor you can click the ""CW"" button
column2: anything in the small warning field above your larger message editor field will be visible. The reader will have to click on ""Show more"" to see the full message.

column1: It is fine to use apps or services which generate toots automatically, but please make sure that you have them under control: make sure they are relevant, try to limit it to a few posts a day. Mark the account as bot. When using bots and cross-posters visit FediScience regularly, if only to interact with replies.
The best way to help is to spread the word! If you starting using Mastodon and find it useful then help out by telling other people about it.

Multiple people have kindly offered to support FediScience financially and since we are getting so many new people onboard that we can make use of the funds to support the infrastructure and moderation costs.
Liberapay is a not-for-profit financed by donations itself.
is a for-profit and more expensive, but we offer it for people's convenience

Sigmoid Social is a Mastodon instance for people researching, working on, or just interested in AI. We went live on 11/04/2022.
You should join Sigmoid Social if you would like to be part of a Mastodon community primarily focused on discussing AI. We do not gatekeep who can join
column2: it does not matter whether you are a researcher, engineer, hacker, student, artist, or just curious.

column1: Sigmoid Social is administered and maintained by The Gradient. The Gradient is a non-profit and volunteer-run organization with the mission of facilitating discussion within the AI community. We were founded in 2017 by a group of students and researchers at the Stanford AI Lab. Our current projects include The Gradient Magazine, The Gradient Podcast, The Update newsletter, and Sigmoid Social.
You can feel free to toot about anything at all, as long as it complies with the Code of Conduct. We may however ask you to migrate to a different instance if your focus is not AI at all.

This server supports translation, so it is ok to post in other languages than English. But, as English as the primary language here, that should ideally be the primary language you use. If you do post in other languages, please tag your posts with the appropriate language label.

We will take appropriate moderation measures against any violations of the Code of Conduct. We also reserve the right to take actions in the best interest of the community in situations we deem harmful but do not clearly violate the Code of Conduct. We will generally lean towards promoting free expression and issuing warning and restrictions rather than bans, but this is absolutely not a free-speech-above-all platform.
How can I share suggestions for Sigmoid Social?
You can message The Gradient via Mastodon, email, Twitter, or pigeon.

Sigmoid Social is hosted by MastHost, a fully managed Mastodon hosting service provided by WAP ‚Äì Web Access Platforms. WAP is a one-person company 100% owned and administrated by Hugo Gameiro. All data storage and processing is done through MastHost.
What happens if The Gradient can no longer maintain Sigmoid Social?

In the case that our current team can no longer run Sigmoid Social, we will attempt to transfer control of it to another non-profit entity within the AI community. If we are unable to do this, we will announce the closure of Sigmoid Social within at least 30 days to allow users to transfer their accounts to other Mastodon instances.

The only way we can access private communications from Sigmoid Social is through exporting the database stored by MastoHost. We will do this periodically for the purpose of storing backups, and in case we have to migrate to another hosting solution. We will not inspect the database for any other reasons. Regardless, we recommend not sharing any private or secure information on this platform.
What is your policy in AI Art and NFTs?
This instance is a great fit for anyone who wants to post AI art - we fully support it. We are also OK with NFT promotion, as long as it relates to AI art and is not spammy.
We generated our banner using MidJourney (a text-to-image AI tool), and intentionally picked out an image that contained a typo as a little in-joke about these tools.
Here are some recommended practices for helping make Sigmoid Social a great place for everyone here:

• Browse the local feed when starting out. Mastodon has three types of feeds: home (people or hashtags you follow), local (all posts from this instance), and federated (all posts from this instance and any users from other instances that are follow by anyone on here). Until you follow some people or hashtags, the local feed is your best bet for discovering content.

• Use hashtags. Mastodon does not have an algorithmic feed, so hashtags are often used for finding content relevant to your interests. So, using hashtags will make it easier for others to find and follow you, and for you to find others as well. We list a set of recommended hashtags below!
<li>Use the unlisted privacy setting in replies and threads. The default post privacy in Mastodon is &#39
column3: , which gets posted to the local timeline, whereas &#39
column5: is only shown when browsing the replies to a given post. Using unlisted for most replies and threads makes the timeline less cleaner and nicer to browse.

column1: • Look into the non-official apps for Mastodon. There are some apps not made by Mastodon that provide an arguably better frontend. Examples include Tusky and Toot!
<li>Consider using content warnings/content labels. The CW button when writing posts stands for &#39
column3: , and then you include one in your post only the text for it is shown unless a user presses a button to see the rest of the post. We recommend using it for sensitive content, but you can also use them like a subject line or TLDR as well!

column1: • Explore Mastodon notification options. Mastodon allows you to mute various types of notifications, which can make it easier to focus on just replies and ignore favorites or boosts if you prefer to do so.

• Report any content you think might violate the code of conduct. Moderation on Mastodon primarily relies on the users reporting objectionable content, at which point our mods can take care of it. Reporting bad content will make the experience on Sigmoid Social better for everyone!
<li>Aim to be generally civil and friendly :)
As is true for Mastodon in general, we recommend you use hashtags in your posts. The following are just some you may want to use:
• #PaperThread - for threads summarizing your or others' papers!
• #SOTA - for stuff related to state of the art!
• #CV - for stuff related to computer vision!
• #RL - for stuff related to reinforcement learning!
• #genAI - for stuff related to generative AI!
• #llm - for stuff related to language models!
• #GoodMorning - for wishing everyone a good morning!
• #GoodNight - for wishing everyone a good night!
• #media - for discussion of movies, books, comics, etc
• #SigmoidSocial - for stuff related to Sigmoid Social
• #TOOTTOOT - just to add a little fun flair to your toots :P
Sigmoid Social is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone.

We want this community to maintain a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. In keeping with these aims, we do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from Sigmoid Social at the discretion of the organizers of the Gradient.
Harassment, including the following activities, will not be tolerated:
• Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
• Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
• Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names.
• Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they‚Äôre not appropriate.

• Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ""hug"" or ‚Äúbackrub‚Äú) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence.
• Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
• Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.

• Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others. Sigmoid Social is intended to be a welcoming platform, so while friendships in support of research are encouraged, note that Sigmoid Social is not a dating platform. Flirting or other unprofessional behavior may make someone uncomfortable. If a member requests another member to stop this type of behavior and it continues, it will be considered harassment.
• Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
• Deliberate ""outing"" of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
• Impersonation with the intent to deceive users (satire is ok).
• Explicitly rude or degrading remarks in general.

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a user of Sigmoid Social, notice that someone else is being harassed, believe confidentiality has been violated, or have any other concerns, please report this via the standard Mastodon tools. We will respond as promptly as we can.
organizers reserve the right to exclude people from Sigmoid Social based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Sigmoid Social.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we‚Äôve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of the members Sigmoid Social or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from Sigmoid Social and identification of the participant as a harasser to other members of Mastodon.

Credit and License

This policy is licensed under the Creative Commons Zero license. It was inspired by and parts were copied from the ML Collective Code of Conduct.
We are grateful for the members who already us through Patreon! As a small thank you, here are links to their Sigmoid Social accounts:

another. That definition does not include the simultaneous
posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.
• You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
• Read more on post and account visibility here
What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon
If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you‚Äôre not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.
• United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
• Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Aethy is a safe haven for creative and unique people and communities to flourish! This server is for people to be able to express themselves by sharing their creations, talk about their interests, or just be themselves in an environment that doesn't allow harassment to flourish. In contrast to other environments online, we also want to be a safe space for marginalized individuals including queer folks, people of color, and women by disallowing hateful speech and ideals.

As advertisers become prevalent in online spaces, many sites limit what type of content is allowed in order to appease them. From banning nudity all the way to banning strange and niche kinks! By contrast, Aethy embraces and loves the human body! We love when adults get kinky and sometimes downright strange with their sexuality! We don't believe in regressive ideologies that limit creative speech and content between consenting adults. With that belief in mind, we made Aethy. The policies were envisioned and sculpted by people who've dealt with hate all their lives, as well as experiencing mental, physical, and sexual abuse (both as minors and as adults). It's extremely important to us that we create a safe space for our community so we've built the site on the principles of inclusion and consent.

Instead of continuing to be squeezed out of spaces because perhaps we're too weird, too queer, or too kinky... we've made our own space! We don't think there's any wrong way to express ourselves as long as we adhere to the principles of consent and inclusion! We no longer want to inhabit spaces where we're beholden to advertisers, puritans and those that wish to spread hate!
Help us run Aethy! We take donations via the following means:
Here's the cost breakdown for running Aethy:
What is a or ""CW?""

or a ""CW"" is short for ""Content Warning"". When a user is making a post, they have the option to click a button that has a symbol. This is used to warn other users about content they might not wish to see (such as sexual or violent content).
What content needs a ?

Public and Unlisted Posts that contain sexual themes, gore, and depictions/discussions of sensitive topics require warnings. Any media where the intent is to arouse is included in this (even if a censor bar or a blur effect is applied). This also includes images where the subject is posed in a sexual manner, or if a body part is framed in an attempt to be arousing. Light blood doesn't require a but beyond that, a is most likely required. Finally, sensitive topics include politics, religion, spirituality, niche belief systems, abuse (including relationship which would be abusive in reality), current events and other topics that could potentially upset someone.
Just do your best though! No one is gonna get in trouble unless they're intentionally trying to upset other users!
What happens if I forget to add a ?

The best thing to do is to quickly edit your post and add one. Otherwise, you'll receive a reminder from a staff member reminding you to add one provided the post content isn't deemed to be too upsetting! Staff members will also typically give suggestions as to what tags may be appropriate. However, if the lack of a on a post could be extremely distressing to viewers, the post may be deleted and need to be redrafted from your email. Accounts that ignore staff warnings may also be Limited so the posts don't appear in public timelines and all images will be marked as ""sensitive"". To have the Limited status removed, simply edit your posts to include a and then appeal the Limited status. Punitive action will never be taken, we will simply put measures in place to protect other users from content they may wish to avoid!
What if my s aren't good enough?

Try your best! If the s aren't comprehensive enough, the staff's course of action will be similar to the above. As a general rule of thumb, try to avoid simply marking a post as ""NSFW"" or something similar. Ask yourself why it's NSFW and list those reasons in the CW. Also avoid overly broad CWs such as ""Nudity"", ""Age Gap"", ""Dead Dove"", etc. Be specific about the subjects and what content is involved!
What's an example of a ?

Examples for sexual content are ""Kink"", ""Sex"", ""Sexual Nudity"", ""Boner"", ""Erection"", ""Het"", ""GL"", ‚ÄúBL‚Äù, ‚ÄúMLM‚Äù, ‚ÄúAnal‚Äù, ‚ÄúBlowjob‚Äù, ‚ÄúBoner‚Äù, ‚ÄúBlood‚Äù, ‚ÄúGore‚Äù, ‚ÄúVore‚Äù, ‚ÄúMacro‚Äù, ""Age gap"", ‚ÄúUnderage‚Äù, ""Shota"", ""Loli"", ‚ÄúMinor/Adult‚Äù, ""Teen/Adult"", etc.
An example for a heavier topic could include ""Politics"", ""Hate Speech"", ""Harassment"", ""Discourse"", ""Syscourse"", etc.
When it comes to religion, spirituality and niche belief systems and frameworks, some examples are ""Spirituality, ""Religion"", ""Otherkin"", ""Therian"", ""Christian"", ""Jesus"", etc.

Basically, the more specific you can get, the better! But you also don't have to make an essay out of it! However, please avoid using loaded words that can be used synonymously with real abuse as s. s are meant to allow people to avoid content they don't wish to see and should do so without causing distress to others.
Does simple nudity require a ?

Nope! Content warnings are not required for non-sexual nudity (e.g. images that don't feature close-ups of genitals, boners, or sex acts). Basically, if it's an image you'd find in an art museum or if the intention of the content isn't to arouse, it doesn't need a . This policy doesn't discriminate against age or body type either. If the subject is a real adult and has consented, or if it's a fictional drawing, then nudity is no different than if the subject is clothed! This also means images that contain nudity can be used in profile icons and banners!
You‚Äôre still free to use content warnings when they‚Äôre not required, however!

Any image where the intent is to arouse or where the subjects featured are engaged in a sexual act. This may even include images that don't feature sexual nudity such as images that contain bodily fluids or where the subject(s) are posed in a sexual nature. It also includes images that attempt to censor the sexual content (e.g. placing a bar over a boner or blurring it). Basically, if it's obvious what's going on, it needs a !
Can I boost content from another server that doesn't have a ?

Yes! We don't want to discourage interacting with other servers even when their policies relating to s differ from ours. Users are encouraged to proceed with caution when viewing posts from other servers. However, if a post isn't marked as ""sensitive"" when it would be required to have a on Aethy, please report it so we can mark it ourselves!
Can I post content I don't own the rights to?

This isn't legal advice but typically screenshots, cropped comic panels, clips from television, etc. fall under Fair Use in the United States. This also includes fan art, fan fiction, and other such content. Staff members will not typically remove content from mass media properties that we believe to fall under Fair Use. However, if a user uploads full television episodes or movies, copyrighted music, and other such content, it will be removed and the user suspended as it is not Fair Use. Also, when it comes to independent creators, we ask that you do not repost their creations (e.g. artwork, photos, videos, etc.) without the creator's permission. We also ask that you don't include their characters in your creations in a way that could cause duress (e.g. drawing sexual imagery of someone's mascot character without their permission).
Can I upload works created with AI?

Yes but it must be disclosed. AI assisted works (such as art where background elements are created by AI) simply require disclosure of the tool used in the post body. However, when posting works created entirely (or nearly entirely) by AI, a must be added indicating that it's AI generated and what tool was used to create it. However, works that were created by directly modifying someone else's copyrighted content may not be posted unless the original content falls under Fair Use. The AI used must also have been trained in a clean room environment that wasn't trained using real human subjects. Especially in the case of pictures featuring underage characters.
Our policies are available on our Policies page. There you can find our:
• Our blobcat emojis were created by Nitro Blob Hub and are licensed under Apache 2.0
• Our shroom emojis and Grumpy Wolf emojis were created by MeowStreamShop

• Our dragn emojis were created by khr and Ember and are licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International with the exception of drgn_hug, which was made by t3rminus
• Our penis, vagina, and breast emojis were created by Iconixar
Here's the cost breakdown for running Aethy:

Servers who block us

Servers on the fediverse generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are a few of the larger servers that have made an exception for us and have disallowed all interactions from our users. This is typically due to our stance on creative fiction and kink. Nothing can be done to re-enable access from our end so if you have friends on these servers, we suggest either reaching out to the admin of the server they're on or requesting your friend move to a less restrictive server.

6387ec68b3a14f89149eaea6,stranger.social,False,9503,"

Stranger.social is a general use server and open to the public. This server is US based server. Cloud hosted and backed-up daily.

Community Support - Our Mastodon server is run by a team of volunteers and is supported by the community. We rely on the generosity of our users to help cover the costs of running the server, such as hosting fees, domain registration, and other expenses.
If you would like to help support our server, there are several ways you can contribute:
• Share our server with your friends and encourage them to join
• Your support is greatly appreciated and helps to ensure that our server can continue to operate and thrive. Thank you for being a part of our community!

Code of Conduct - Welcome to our Mastodon server! We are a community of Strangers looking for safe harbor in our Social Media lives. To ensure that everyone has a positive and enjoyable experience on our server, we have established the following rules of conduct.
• Be respectful and considerate of others. This means no hate speech, harassment, or discrimination of any kind.
• Keep the conversation appropriate for all ages, within reason. This means no explicit or graphic content that is not suitable for a general audience.
• Do not spam or engage in malicious activity. This includes bot spam, phishing attempts, and other harmful behavior.
• Follow the law. This includes not sharing illegal or copyrighted material.
<li>Use common sense and good judgment. If you&#39
column2: re not sure if something is appropriate, ask a moderator or administrator. We&#39
column3: re not here to be tyrants, we just want everyone to have a good time.

column1: • We reserve the right to remove any content or accounts that violate these rules, or that we deem harmful to the community. We also reserve the right to modify these rules as necessary. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact a moderator or administrator.
Thank you for being a part of our community!
Status Page Please visit our Status Page for real-time status of the server.

Bot Developers - Welcome bot developers! We invite you to join our Mastodon server and enhance the user experience. Please check in with our server admin @azcoigreach before deploying any bots and be ethical and constructive in your development.

Reporting and Moderation - When reporting accounts, please include at least a few postings that demonstrate rule-breaking behavior, if appropriate. Please provide any relevant supporting information in the comment if it could be used to inform a decision. This is especially crucial when the content is in a language other than English.

We typically respond to reports within 24 hours. Please keep in mind that you are not contacted when a complaint you filed results in a punitive action, and that not all punitive acts are apparent from the outside. We may choose to erase offensive content for first-time offenses before progressing to harsher sanctions for repeat violations.

Show off your canine pride at bark.lgbt. A alternative to meowing at meow.social
Report the post in question or send a email to admin@bark.lgbt. We take these claims very seriously and will come back to you within a day
• You? - reach out to admin today if you would like to help us moderate this instance.

We want everyone on this instance to feel comfortable expressing themselves. That being said there are limits. We have zero tolerance for any blatant homophobia / transphobia / trolling / hating and in general just people that are here to ruin the mood. We are lgbt+ run and supportive.

Registering an account on this instance means you are at least 18 years old. Additionally you agree that browsing the timelines from this instance might expose you to not-safe-for-work and other unwanted material. This is due to the nature of the fediverse. You agree to report these posts so our moderator team can take actions against the violating instance or user.
If you are uncomfortable with certain types of content we highly recommend making use of filters https://bark.lgbt/filters to filter out commonly used hashtags that you would like to avoid.
If your account is identified as being younger than 18 years old and you are seen posting NSFW content your account will be suspended. This falls under illegal content.

We accept the posting of NSFW content however to protect other instances feeds we require not safe for work (NFSW) content to be tagged appropriately. Use both a content warning (CW) and blur media if any media is attached. If this is violated your post may be removed and repeated violation of this rule will result in a ban.

Profile pictures and profile headers MUST be PG-13 and cannot be NSFW / explicit. If your profile is found to violate this rule our moderators will remove your profile picture and/or header. You are then free to upload a alternative that does adhere to this rule.
Zoophillia is not accepted on this instance, nor any mention of it.

This is not a exhaustive list of rules and by registering to this instance you agree that we can add, remove or modify rules without prior notice. If you are in breach of one of our rules our moderator team will contact you and attempt to resolve the situation. If you are uncooperative we may choose to suspend your account on this instance.

While we are (canine) furry focused everyone is welcome to join in the howl! No matter your species. Non-furry content is allowed as well, do keep in mind to CW your posts if they include anything you don'
column2: t want to see in public, Especially NSFW!

column1: See something? Say something! Use the report feature to report posts and our team will review them on a case-by-case basis. All reports will be handled fairly for all parties involved.
While we are a primary English speaking instance we do offer translations using our libretranslate server. This is integrated in Mastodon.
When you create a post you can specify which language you are typing your post in. Choosing one of the above languages will offer users of this instance a '
column3: button to automatically translate your posts content into English

column1: Our team regularly monitors the #fediblock hashtag and acts accordingly. Additionally if we identify a malicious instance our team will announce this to #fediblock.
We obscure the names of all instances that are suspended/silenced. If you suspect we have blocked your instance and you want to appeal then please contact our team via email [admin@bark.lgbt]
If you own a account on our instance you have the ability to export all the data this instance has of you, as well as request complete account deletion.
Are you feeling generous? Did we do an amazing job with something? Or are you just enjoying the service we'
We are private individuals operating this instance not-for-profit. We will never sell your data and never show advertisements on our instance.

Donations are always most welcome as these will assist us with paying monthly infrastructure fees. Donations are not mandatory but are greatly appreciated. Donations will be shared on @bark as well. We want to let everyone know the money we receive is being put into the instance, be it infrastructure improvements or compensation to our moderators (instance owner excluded)
When you choose to register an account on this instance we keep minimal information needed to make the site function for you on our systems. This includes, but is not limited to:
This information is collected to assist our moderators and create aggregate instance usage data.
System logs are only stored for up to an hour for troubleshooting purposes.
,Furry focused instance for critters that like to bark!

Welcome to AI.Wiki, the decentralized artificial intelligence censorship-proof social media network that is revolutionizing the way we communicate online. Built For Small Business, By Small Business! Bring your friends too!
AI.Wiki is a decentralized social media platform that provides several benefits to businesses. Here are some of the key advantages:
• Control: Unlike centralized social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter, Mastodon gives businesses more control over their content and how it'
column2: s shared. Mastodon users can create their own servers or join existing ones, and they have complete control over their data.

column1: • Privacy: AI.Wiki is designed with privacy in mind. Users can control who sees their content and messages, and there are no third-party advertisers tracking their activity. This can be particularly beneficial for businesses that deal with sensitive or confidential information.

• Niche Communities: AI.Wiki allows businesses to connect with niche communities that may not be easily accessible on traditional social media platforms. By joining a relevant Mastodon server, businesses can engage with potential customers who share their interests.
• No Algorithms: Unlike traditional social media platforms, AI.Wiki doesn'
column2: t use algorithms to determine what content users see. This means that businesses have a better chance of their content being seen by their followers.

column1: • Cost-Effective: AI.Wiki is a cost-effective social media platform, especially for small businesses that may not have the resources to invest in traditional social media advertising. Businesses can create an AI.Wiki account for FREE and use it to connect with potential customers and friends.

column2: s decentralized structure provides businesses with more control, privacy, and opportunities to connect with niche communities. It&#39
column3: s also a cost-effective alternative to traditional social media advertising.

column1: AI.Wiki server accepts ALL business postings. It is important to note that users have the option to block individual users or entire instances if they do not want to see certain content. This is a personal choice and may vary from user to user. Ultimately, it'
column2: s up to each user to decide what content they want to see on their timeline and take appropriate action to manage it. PLEASE, if you do not want to see business offers, instead of reporting anyone from AI.Wiki server, PLEASE block the user or the whole server/instance, Thank you

column1: AI.Wiki is a decentralized social media platform, which means that there is no central authority governing what content can or cannot be posted. Each Mastodon server is run by an individual or organization who sets their own rules for what is allowed on their server. Many Mastodon servers are open to accepting business postings because they recognize the value of having businesses as part of their community. Businesses can bring in new users, provide interesting content, and even help support the server financially through donations or paid accounts.

At AI.Wiki, we believe in the power of technology to connect people, ideas, and knowledge across the world. We also recognize the importance of preserving free speech and open discourse, which is why we have created a platform that is censorship-proof and resistant to outside influence.

Our platform is built on Mastodon, a decentralized social network that allows users to communicate and share content without fear of censorship or surveillance. This means that AI.Wiki users have the freedom to express themselves in any way they choose, without worrying about their content being blocked or deleted.

But what really sets AI.Wiki apart is our use of artificial intelligence. Our platform is designed to learn from user behavior and adapt to their preferences, making it easier than ever to find the content that matters most to you. Whether you'
column2: re looking for the latest news, trending topics, or informative articles, AI.Wiki is the place to be.

column1: We believe that AI.Wiki is more than just a social media network. It'
column2: s a community of like-minded individuals who are committed to sharing ideas, knowledge, and information in a safe and secure environment. We invite you to join us and be a part of this exciting new chapter in the evolution of social media.
